It achieves this by mining unparse trees using dynamic taint analysis to extract language keywords, which are leveraged for guided fuzzing. Vulnerabilities can thus be found without requiring prior knowledge about the formal language, and in fact, the approach is even applicable where no specification thereof exists at all. This empowers security researchers and developers alike to gain deeper understanding of unparser implementations through examination of the unparse trees generated by the approach, as well as enabling them to find new vulnerabilities in poorly-understood software.
papers.abstract_zh: 在软件系统需要交换或存储数据的地方，形式语言无处不在。从这种语言中解包和解析是一个容易出错的过程，已经产生了一整类的安全漏洞。在寻找解析器漏洞方面已经有了大量的研究，但是除了特定于语言的方法之外，很少有针对非解析器漏洞的技术。这项工作提出了一种与语言无关的方法来发现解语法分析器中的注入漏洞。它通过使用动态污点分析挖掘非解析树来提取语言关键字来实现这一点，这些关键字用于引导模糊化。因此，可以在不需要关于形式语言的先验知识的情况下发现弱点，并且事实上，该方法甚至适用于根本不存在规范的情况。这使安全研究人员和开发人员能够通过检查由该方法生成的非解析树来更深入地了解非解析实现，并使他们能够在了解不多的软件中发现新的漏洞。这项工作提出了一种与语言无关的方法来发现解语法分析器中的注入漏洞。它通过使用动态污点分析挖掘非解析树来提取语言关键字来实现这一点，这些关键字用于引导模糊化。因此，可以在不需要关于形式语言的先验知识的情况下发现弱点，并且事实上，该方法甚至适用于根本不存在规范的情况。这使安全研究人员和开发人员能够通过检查由该方法生成的非解析树来更深入地了解非解析实现，并使他们能够在了解不多的软件中发现新的漏洞。
papers.title_zh: 语言不可知的注入检测

papers.title: Toward Automated Grammar Extraction via Semantic Labeling of Parser Implementations
papers.authors: Carson Harmon, Bradford Larsen, Evan A. Sultanik
papers.abstract: This paper introduces a new approach for labeling the semantic purpose of the functions in a parser. An input file with a known syntax tree is passed to a copy of the target parser that has been instrumented for universal taint tracking. A novel algorithm is used to merge that syntax tree ground truth with the observed taint and control-flow information from the parser's execution, producing a mapping from types in the file format to the set of functions most specialized in operating on that type. The resulting mapping has applications in mutational fuzzing, reverse engineering, differential analysis, as well as automated grammar extraction. We demonstrate that even a single execution of an instrumented parser with a single input file can lead to a mapping that a human would identify as intuitively correct. We hope that this approach will lead to both safer subsets of file formats and safer parsers.
papers.abstract_zh: 本文介绍了一种在解析器中标记函数语义目的的新方法。具有已知语法树的输入文件被传递给目标解析器的一个副本，该副本已经被检测用于通用污点跟踪。一种新颖的算法用于将语法树基础事实与来自解析器执行的观察到的污点和控制流信息合并，产生从文件格式的类型到最专门用于操作该类型的函数集的映射。所得到的映射在突变模糊化、逆向工程、差异分析以及自动语法提取中有应用。我们证明了，即使一个带有单个输入文件的解析器的一次执行，也可以产生一个人类可以凭直觉识别为正确的映射。我们希望这种方法能够带来更安全的文件格式子集和更安全的解析器。
papers.title_zh: 通过语法分析器实现的语义标记实现自动语法提取

papers.title: The Geometry of Syntax and Semantics for Directed File Transformations
papers.authors: Steve Huntsman, Michael Robinson
papers.abstract: We introduce a conceptual framework that associates syntax and semantics with vertical and horizontal directions in principal bundles and related constructions. This notion of geometry corresponds to a mechanism for performing goal-directed file transformations such as “eliminate unsafe syntax” and suggests various engineering practices.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们引入了一个概念框架，将语法和语义与主丛和相关结构中的垂直和水平方向联系起来。这种几何概念对应于用于执行目标导向的文件转换的机制，例如“消除不安全的语法”,并建议各种工程实践。
papers.title_zh: 定向文件转换的语法和语义几何

papers.title: Armor Within: Defending Against Vulnerabilities in Third-Party Libraries
papers.authors: Sameed Ali, Prashant Anantharaman, Sean W. Smith
papers.abstract: Vulnerabilities in third-party software modules have resulted in severe security flaws, including remote code execution and denial of service. However, current approaches to securing such libraries suffer from one of two problems. First, they do not perform sufficiently well to be applicable in practice and incur high CPU and memory overheads. Second, they are also harder to apply to legacy and proprietary systems when the source code of the application is not available. There is, therefore, a dire need to secure the internal boundaries within an application to ensure vulnerable software modules are not exploitable via crafted input attacks. We present a novel approach to secure third-party software modules without requiring access to the source code of the program. First, using the foundations of language-theoretic security, we build a validation filter for the vulnerable module. Using the foundations of linking and loading, we present two different ways to insert that filter between the main code and the vulnerable module. Finally, using the foundations of ELF-based access control, we ensure any entry into the vulnerable module must first go through the filter. We evaluate our approaches using three known real-world exploits in two popular libraries-libpng and libxml. We were able to successfully prevent all three exploits from executing.
papers.abstract_zh: 第三方软件模块中的漏洞导致了严重的安全缺陷，包括远程代码执行和拒绝服务。然而，目前保护这些库的方法存在两个问题。首先，它们的性能不够好，无法在实践中应用，并且会产生很高的CPU和内存开销。其次，当应用程序的源代码不可用时，它们也很难应用于遗留和专有系统。因此，迫切需要保护应用程序内部的边界，以确保易受攻击的软件模块不会被精心制作的输入攻击所利用。我们提出了一种新的方法来保护第三方软件模块，而不需要访问程序的源代码。首先，使用语言理论安全的基础，我们为易受攻击的模块建立一个验证过滤器。使用链接和加载的基础，我们提出了两种不同的方法来在主代码和易受攻击的模块之间插入过滤器。最后，使用基于ELF的访问控制的基础，我们确保任何对易受攻击模块的进入必须首先通过过滤器。我们使用两个流行的库libpng和libxml中的三个已知的真实漏洞来评估我们的方法。我们成功地阻止了所有这三种攻击。
papers.title_zh: 内部防护:防御第三方库中的漏洞

papers.title: Research Report: The Parsley Data Format Definition Language
papers.authors: Prashanth Mundkur, Linda Briesemeister, Natarajan Shankar, Prashant Anantharaman, Sameed Ali, Zephyr Lucas, Sean W. Smith
papers.abstract: Any program that reads formatted input relies on parsing software to check the input for validity and transform it into a representation suitable for further processing. Many security vulnerabilities can be attributed to poorly defined grammars, incorrect parsing, and sloppy input validation. In contrast to programming languages, grammars for even common data formats such as ELF and PDF are typically context-sensitive and heterogenous. However, as in programming languages, a standard notation or language to express these data format grammars can address poor or ambiguous definitions, and the automated generation of correct-by-construction parsers from such grammar specifications can yield correct and type- and memory-safe data parsing routines. We present our ongoing work on developing such a data format description language. Parsley is a declarative data format definition language that combines grammars and constraints in a modular way. We show how it can be used to capture data formats such as MAVLink, PDF and ELF. We briefly describe the processing pipeline we are designing to generate verified parsers from these specifications.
papers.abstract_zh: 任何读取格式化输入的程序都依赖解析软件来检查输入的有效性，并将其转换为适合进一步处理的表示形式。许多安全漏洞可归因于定义不当的语法、不正确的解析和草率的输入验证。与编程语言相反，即使是ELF和PDF等常见数据格式的语法也是典型的上下文敏感和异构的。然而，如同在编程语言中一样，表达这些数据格式语法的标准符号或语言可以解决不良或不明确的定义，并且从这种语法规范自动生成构造正确的解析器可以产生正确的、类型和内存安全的数据解析例程。我们目前正在开发这样一种数据格式描述语言。欧芹是一种声明式数据格式定义语言，它以模块化的方式结合了语法和约束。我们展示了如何使用它来捕获MAVLink、PDF和ELF等数据格式。我们简要描述了我们正在设计的处理管道，以便从这些规范中生成经过验证的解析器。
papers.title_zh: 研究报告:欧芹数据格式定义语言

papers.title: Research Report: Formally-Verified ASN.1 Protocol C-language Stack
papers.authors: Nika Pona, Vadim Zaliva
papers.abstract: We describe our approach and progress in verification of a mature open-source ASN.1 compiler, ASN1C, using the Coq proof assistant. Once completed, our project will provide state-of-the-art high assurance suitable for mission-critical systems. Furthermore, since formal verification will be layered atop a well-tested ASN.1 stack, it will combine the benefits of high-performance portable stack implementation with formal correctness guarantees. As an essential step in our approach, the project will also provide a formalization of a key part of the ASN.1 standard. Such formal specification could subsequently be used by others to analyze ASN.1 properties and validate other implementations.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们描述了使用Coq proof assistant验证一个成熟的开源ASN.1编译器ASN1C的方法和过程。一旦完成，我们的项目将提供适用于关键任务系统的最先进的高保证。此外，由于形式验证将位于经过充分测试的ASN.1堆栈之上，它将结合高性能可移植堆栈实现的优势和形式正确性保证。作为我们方法中的重要一步，该项目还将提供ASN.1标准关键部分的形式化。其他人随后可以使用这种正式规范来分析ASN.1属性和验证其他实现。
papers.title_zh: 研究报告:正式验证的ASN.1协议C语言堆栈

papers.title: Research Report: Building a Wide Reach Corpus for Secure Parser Development
papers.authors: Tim Allison, Wayne Burke, Valentino Constantinou, Edwin Goh, Chris Mattmann, Anastasija Mensikova, Philip Southam, Ryan Stonebraker, Virisha Timmaraju
papers.abstract: Computer software that parses electronic files is often vulnerable to maliciously crafted input data. Rather than relying on developers to implement ad hoc defenses against such data, the Language-theoretic security (LangSec) philosophy offers formally correct and verifiable input handling throughout the software development lifecycle. Whether developing from a specification or deriving parsers from samples, LangSec parser developers require wide-reach corpora of their target file format in order to identify key edge cases or common deviations from the format's specification. In this research report, we provide the details of several methods we have used to gather approximately 30 million files, extract features and make these features amenable to search and use in analytics. Additionally, we provide documentation on opportunities and limitations of some popular open-source datasets and annotation tools that will benefit researchers which need to efficiently gather a large file corpus for the purposes of LangSec parser development.
papers.abstract_zh: 解析电子文件的计算机软件通常容易受到恶意制作的输入数据的攻击。语言理论安全(LangSec)哲学在整个软件开发生命周期中提供了形式上正确且可验证的输入处理，而不是依赖开发人员来实现对此类数据的特别防御。无论是从规范开发还是从样本派生解析器，LangSec解析器开发人员都需要其目标文件格式的广泛语料库，以便识别关键的边缘情况或与格式规范的常见偏差。在这份研究报告中，我们提供了几种方法的详细信息，这些方法用于收集大约3000万个文件，提取特征，并使这些特征便于搜索和在分析中使用。此外，我们还提供了关于一些流行的开源数据集和注释工具的机会和局限性的文档，这将有助于需要高效收集大型文件语料库以用于LangSec解析器开发的研究人员。
papers.title_zh: 研究报告:为安全解析器的开发建立一个大范围的语料库

papers.title: Research Report: ICARUS: Understanding De Facto Formats by Way of Feathers and Wax
papers.authors: Sam Cowger, Yerim Lee, Nichole Schimanski, Mark Tullsen, Walter Woods, Richard Jones, E. W. Davis, William Harris, Trent Brunson, Carson Harmon, Bradford Larsen, Evan Sultanik
papers.abstract: When $a$ data format achieves a significant level of adoption, the presence of multiple format implementations expands the original specification in often-unforeseen ways. This results in an implicitly defined, de facto format, which can create vulnerabilities in programs handling the associated data files. In this paper we present our initial work on ICARUS: a toolchain for dealing with the problem of understanding and hardening de facto file formats. We show the results of our work in progress in the following areas: labeling and categorizing a corpora of data format samples to understand accepted variations of a format; the detection of sublanguages within the de facto format using both entropy- and taint-tracking-based methods, as a means of breaking down the larger problem of learning how the grammar has evolved; grammar inference via reinforcement learning, as a means of tying together the learned sublanguages; and the defining of both safe subsets of the de facto grammar, as well as translations from unsafe regions of the de facto grammar into safe regions. Real-world data formats evolve as they find use in real-world applications, and a comprehensive ICARUS toolchain for understanding and hardening the resulting de facto formats can identify and address security risks arising from this evolution.
papers.abstract_zh: 当$a$数据格式被大量采用时，多种格式实现的出现以通常无法预见的方式扩展了原始规范。这会导致隐式定义的事实格式，从而在处理相关数据文件的程序中产生漏洞。在本文中，我们展示了我们在ICARUS上的初步工作:一个用于处理理解和强化事实文件格式问题的工具链。我们展示了我们在以下领域正在进行的工作的结果:对数据格式样本的语料库进行标记和分类，以理解格式的可接受变体；使用基于熵和污点跟踪的方法检测事实格式中的子语言，作为分解学习语法如何演变的更大问题的手段；通过强化学习进行语法推理，作为将所学的子语言联系在一起的一种手段；以及定义事实语法的安全子集，以及从事实语法的不安全区域到安全区域的翻译。现实世界的数据格式随着在现实世界的应用中的使用而不断发展，用于理解和强化所产生的事实格式的全面的ICARUS工具链可以识别和解决这种发展带来的安全风险。

papers.title: Message from the General Chair
papers.authors: Alvaro A. Cárdenas
papers.abstract: Welcome to the 36th International Symposium on Microarchitecture, or Micro-36, as it is fondly known. I served as the General Chair for Micro this year, while Brad Calder was kind enough to serve as the Program Chair. In practical terms, this means that while Brad managed the process of assembling an excellent program, I was responsible for encouraging a group of over worked volunteers from our community to take on even more work and help out with all other aspects. In exchange, I offer them my thanks here and encourage you to do the same in person. Dean Tullsen managed the local arrangements—if you enjoy the dinner cruise, please give him your thanks. Gokhan Memik was in charge of publications, but had the misfortune of spending too much time near my office. As a consequence, he took on many other roles, and in general kept things on track and moving forward. Glenn Reiman managed the process of arranging the tutorials and workshops that preceded the main conference. These events have been an important and exhilarating adjunct to the main meeting, and I am looking forward to them with great anticipation. Jason Fritts was kind enough to serve as our publicity chair. Finally, Roger Bringmann was this year’s chair for registration. I thank all of these people, in addition to the Steering Committee, for their hard work in making Micro-36 possible. If you enjoy the conference and find it as valuable as I do, please make a point of seeking out these volunteers and thanking them for their efforts. If you find any problems or have complaints, look for me! Best regards and wishing you a valuable, educational and entertaining meeting!
papers.abstract_zh: 欢迎参加第36届国际微体系结构研讨会，或被亲切地称为Micro-36。今年，我担任了Micro的总主席，而Brad Calder则担任了项目主席。实际上，这意味着当Brad管理组装一个优秀程序的过程时，我负责鼓励来自我们社区的一组加班的志愿者承担更多的工作，并在所有其他方面提供帮助。作为交换，我在这里向他们表示感谢，并鼓励你们也亲自这样做。迪安·塔尔森负责当地的安排——如果你喜欢晚餐巡游，请向他表示感谢。戈汗·梅米克负责出版物，但不幸的是，他在我的办公室附近呆了太长时间。因此，他承担了许多其他角色，总体来说，让事情走上正轨并向前发展。Glenn Reiman负责安排主要会议之前的辅导课和研讨会。这些活动是对主要会议的重要和令人振奋的补充，我满怀期待地期待着它们。杰森·弗里兹好心地担任了我们的宣传主席。最后，罗杰·布林曼是今年的注册主席。我感谢所有这些人，以及指导委员会，感谢他们为使Micro-36成为可能所做的辛勤工作。如果你喜欢这次会议，并且和我一样觉得它很有价值，请一定要找到这些志愿者，感谢他们的努力。如果你发现任何问题或有投诉，找我！向您致以最诚挚的问候，并祝您参加一次有价值、有教育意义和娱乐性的会议！
papers.title_zh: 主席的致辞

papers.title: Discovering and Measuring Malicious URL Redirection Campaigns from Fake News Domains
papers.authors: Zhouhan Chen, Juliana Freire
papers.abstract: Malicious URLs are used to distribute malware and launch social engineering attacks. They often hide behind redirection networks to evade detection. Due to the difficulty in discovering redirection traffic in real-time, previous approaches to understanding redirection networks were reactive and passive. We propose a proactive algorithm that is able to uncover redirection networks in real-time given a small set of seed domains. Our method works in three steps: (1) collecting redirection paths, (2) clustering domains that share common nodes along redirection paths, and (3) searching for other domains co-hosted on similar IP addresses. We evaluate our method using real websites that we discovered while auditing 2,300 popular fake news sites. We seeded our algorithm with a subset of 276 fake news domains that redirect, and uncovered three large-scale redirection campaigns. We further verified that 91% of entry point domains were not new, but recently expired, re-registered, and parked on dedicated hosts. To mitigate this threat vector, we deployed our system to automatically collect newly re-registered domains and publish new redirection networks. During a five-month period, our threat intelligence reports have received over 50,000 Google Search impressions, and have been recommended by commercial vendor tools. We also reported findings to Google and Amazon Web Services, both of which have acted promptly to remove malicious artifacts. Our work offers a viable approach to continuously discover evasive redirection traffic from re-registered domains.
papers.abstract_zh: 恶意网址被用来分发恶意软件和发动社会工程攻击。他们经常躲在重定向网络后面以逃避检测。由于实时发现重定向流量的困难，以前理解重定向网络的方法是反应性的和被动的。我们提出了一种主动算法，能够在给定一小组种子域的情况下实时发现重定向网络。我们的方法分三步工作:(1)收集重定向路径，(2)沿着重定向路径聚集共享公共节点的域，以及(3)搜索在相似IP地址上共同托管的其他域。我们使用我们在审计2300个流行的假新闻网站时发现的真实网站来评估我们的方法。我们用重定向的276个假新闻域的子集作为我们算法的种子，并发现了三个大规模的重定向活动。我们进一步验证了91%的入口点域不是新的，而是最近过期、重新注册并存放在专用主机上的。为了减轻这种威胁，我们部署了我们的系统来自动收集新的重新注册的域并发布新的重定向网络。在五个月的时间里，我们的威胁情报报告收到了超过50，000次Google搜索，并得到了商业供应商工具的推荐。我们还向Google和Amazon Web Services报告了调查结果，这两家公司都迅速采取行动删除了恶意的人工制品。我们的工作提供了一种可行的方法来连续发现来自重新注册域的规避重定向流量。
papers.title_zh: 从假新闻域中发现和测量恶意URL重定向活动

papers.title: Troubleshooting an Intrusion Detection Dataset: the CICIDS2017 Case Study
papers.authors: Gints Engelen, Vera Rimmer, Wouter Joosen
papers.abstract: Numerous studies have demonstrated the effectiveness of machine learning techniques in application to network intrusion detection. And yet, the adoption of machine learning for securing large-scale network environments remains challenging. The community acknowledges that network security presents unique challenges for machine learning, and the lack of training data representative of modern traffic remains one of the most intractable issues. New attempts are continuously made to develop high quality benchmark datasets and proper data collection methodologies. The CICIDS2017 dataset is one of the recent results, created to meet the demanding criterion of representativeness for network intrusion detection. In this paper we revisit CICIDS2017 and its data collection pipeline and analyze correctness, validity and overall utility of the dataset for the learning task. During this in-depth analysis, we uncover a series of problems with traffic generation, flow construction, feature extraction and labelling that severely affect the aforementioned properties. We investigate the causes of these shortcomings and address most of them by applying an improved data processing methodology. As a result, more than 20 percent of original traffic traces are reconstructed or relabelled. Machine learning benchmarks on the final dataset demonstrate significant improvements. Our study exemplifies how data collection issues may have enormous impact on model evaluation and provides recommendations for their anticipation and prevention.
papers.abstract_zh: 大量研究表明了机器学习技术在网络入侵检测中的有效性。然而，采用机器学习来保护大规模网络环境仍然具有挑战性。社区承认，网络安全给机器学习带来了独特的挑战，缺乏代表现代流量的训练数据仍然是最棘手的问题之一。不断进行新的尝试，以开发高质量的基准数据集和适当的数据收集方法。CICIDS2017数据集是最近的成果之一，旨在满足网络入侵检测代表性的苛刻标准。在本文中，我们重新访问了CICIDS2017及其数据收集管道，并分析了学习任务数据集的正确性、有效性和整体效用。在这一深入分析中，我们发现了一系列严重影响上述属性的流量生成、流构建、特征提取和标记问题。我们调查了这些缺点的原因，并通过应用改进的数据处理方法来解决其中的大部分问题。结果，超过20%的原始交通轨迹被重建或重新标记。最终数据集上的机器学习基准证明了显著的改进。我们的研究举例说明了数据收集问题如何对模型评估产生巨大影响，并为预测和预防这些问题提供了建议。
papers.title_zh: 入侵检测数据集故障排除:CICIDS2017案例研究

papers.title: Training regime influences to semi-supervised learning for insider threat detection
papers.authors: Duc C. Le, Nur Zincir-Heywood, Malcolm I. Heywood
papers.abstract: A malicious insider is one of the most damaging threats to any organization from industry to government agencies. Many challenges from insider threat detection come from the fact that the ground truth is very limited and costly to acquire. This paper presents a semi-supervised learning approach to insider threat detection. We employ three machine learning methods under different real-world conditions. These include obtaining the initial ground truth training data randomly or via a certain type of insider malicious behavior or by anomaly detection system scores. Evaluation results show that the approach allows learning from very limited data for insider threat detection at high precision. 90% of malicious data instances are detected under 1% false positive rate.
papers.abstract_zh: 从工业到政府机构，恶意的内部人员是对任何组织最具破坏性的威胁之一。内部威胁检测面临的许多挑战来自于这样一个事实，即事实真相非常有限且获取成本高昂。提出了一种用于内部威胁检测的半监督学习方法。我们在不同的真实世界条件下采用了三种机器学习方法。这些包括随机地或通过特定类型的内部恶意行为或通过异常检测系统分数获得初始地面实况训练数据。评估结果表明，该方法允许从非常有限的数据中学习，用于高精度的内部威胁检测。90%的恶意数据实例在1%的误报率下被检测到。
papers.title_zh: 训练机制对内部威胁检测半监督学习的影响

papers.title: Examining traffic microstructures to improve model development
papers.authors: Henry Clausen, David Aspinall
papers.abstract: We demonstrate how machine-learning-based network intrusion detection models can be validated and developed by probing models using traffic with specifically controlled microstructures. We show our methodology by probing two published state-of-the-art models to find classification flaws and and understand misbehaviour. These models fail for input traffic with particular characteristics such as retransmissions or overly dispersed flow interarrival times. After we make simple corresponding model corrections, detection rates already improve between 2 -4%. We believe this shows promise for using tailored data with controllable and labelled characteristics to effectively improve model development in NID, a practice that helped model development significantly in several other areas of machinelearning.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们展示了基于机器学习的网络入侵检测模型如何通过使用具有特定控制的微观结构的流量探测模型来验证和开发。我们展示了我们的方法，通过探测两个发表的最先进的模型，以找到分类缺陷和理解不当行为。这些模型不适用于具有特定特征的输入业务，例如重传或到达间隔时间过于分散的流。在我们进行简单的相应模型校正后，检测率已经提高了2 -4%。我们相信这表明了使用具有可控和标记特征的定制数据来有效改善NID模型开发的前景，这种做法在机器学习的其他几个领域中极大地帮助了模型开发。
papers.title_zh: 检查交通微观结构以改进模型开发

papers.title: On the feasibility of short-lived dynamic onion services
papers.authors: Tobias Höller, Thomas Raab, Michael Roland, René Mayrhofer
papers.abstract: Tor onion services utilize the Tor network to enable incoming connections on a device without disclosing its network location. Decentralized systems with extended privacy requirements like metadata-avoiding messengers typically rely on onion services. However, a long-lived onion service address can itself be abused as identifying metadata. Replacing static onion services with dynamic short-lived onion services may be a way to avoid such metadata leakage. This work evaluates the feasibility of short-lived dynamically generated onion services in decentralized systems. We show, based on a detailed timing analysis of the onion service deployment process, that dynamic onion services are already feasible for peer-to-peer communication in certain scenarios.
papers.abstract_zh: Tor onion服务利用Tor网络来启用设备上的传入连接，而不暴露其网络位置。具有扩展隐私需求的分散式系统，如元数据回避信使，通常依赖于洋葱服务。然而，长期存在的洋葱服务地址本身可能被滥用来标识元数据。用动态的短期洋葱服务替换静态洋葱服务可能是避免这种元数据泄漏的一种方法。这项工作评估了分散系统中短期动态生成洋葱服务的可行性。基于对洋葱服务部署过程的详细时间分析，我们表明动态洋葱服务在某些场景中已经可以用于对等通信。
papers.title_zh: 论短期动态洋葱服务的可行性

papers.title: AMon: A Monitoring Multidimensional Feature Application to Secure Android Environments
papers.authors: José Antonio Gómez-Hernández, Pedro García-Teodoro, Juan Antonio Holgado Terriza, Gabriel Maciá-Fernández, José Camacho-Páez, M. Robles-Carrillo
papers.abstract: This work introduces a novel Android monitoring app named AMon. It is aimed at collecting device related information from several sources: communications, /proc filesystem, applications and device usage. The information is dynamically gathered over time and its execution does not require to get special privileges or to be system root. In order to assess AMon capabilities, we have used it as the acquisition module of a subsequent security incident detection process. The results obtained show a good performance in terms of battery consumption, CPU and RAM usage, as well as overall system overhead. In order to contribute to the community, AMon is available at a public repository for free use and improvement.
papers.abstract_zh: 本文介绍了一款名为AMon的新颖Android监控应用。它旨在从几个来源收集设备相关信息:通信、/proc文件系统、应用程序和设备使用情况。信息是随着时间的推移动态收集的，其执行不需要获得特殊权限或成为系统根用户。为了评估AMon的能力，我们将其用作后续安全事件检测流程的采集模块。所获得的结果显示了在电池消耗、CPU和RAM使用以及整体系统开销方面的良好性能。为了对社区有所贡献，AMon可以在公共存储库中免费使用和改进。
papers.title_zh: AMon:一个监控多维特性的应用程序，用于保护Android环境

papers.title: DPI Solutions in Practice: Benchmark and Comparison
papers.authors: Tommaso Rescio, Thomas Favale, Francesca Soro, Marco Mellia, Idilio Drago
papers.abstract: Having a clear insight on the protocols carrying traffic is crucial for network applications. Deep Packet Inspection (DPI) has been a key technique to provide visibility into traffic. DPI has proven effective in various scenarios, and indeed several open source DPI solutions are maintained by the community. Yet, these solutions provide different classifications, and it is hard to establish a common ground truth. Independent works approaching the question of the quality of DPI are already aged and rely on limited datasets. Here, we test if open source DPI solutions can provide useful information in practical scenarios, e.g., supporting security applications. We provide an evaluation of the performance of four open-source DPI solutions, namely nDPI, Libprotoident, Tstat and Zeek. We use datasets covering various traffic scenarios, including operational networks, IoT scenarios and malware. As no ground truth is available, we study the consistency of classification across the solutions, investigating rootcauses of conflicts. Important for on-line security applications, we check whether DPI solutions provide reliable classification with a limited number of packets per flow. All in all, we confirm that DPI solutions still perform satisfactorily for well-known protocols. They however struggle with some P2P traffic and security scenarios (e.g., with malware traffic). All tested solutions reach a final classification after observing few packets with payload, showing adequacy for on-line applications.
papers.abstract_zh: 清楚地了解承载流量的协议对于网络应用至关重要。深度数据包检测(DPI)是提供流量可见性的关键技术。DPI已经在各种场景中被证明是有效的，事实上社区维护着几个开源的DPI解决方案。然而，这些解决方案提供了不同的分类，很难建立一个共同的基础事实。处理DPI质量问题的独立作品已经过时，并且依赖于有限的数据集。在这里，我们测试开源DPI解决方案是否可以在实际场景中提供有用的信息，例如，支持安全应用程序。我们提供了四个开源DPI解决方案的性能评估，即nDPI、Libprotoident、Tstat和Zeek。我们使用涵盖各种流量场景的数据集，包括运营网络、物联网场景和恶意软件。由于没有可用的基本事实，我们研究解决方案分类的一致性，调查冲突的根本原因。重要的是，对于在线安全应用程序，我们检查DPI解决方案是否通过每个流的有限数量的数据包提供可靠的分类。总而言之，我们确认DPI解决方案对于众所周知的协议仍然表现令人满意。然而，他们与一些P2P流量和安全场景(例如，恶意软件流量)斗争。所有测试的解决方案在观察到少量具有有效载荷的分组后达到最终分类，显示出对于在线应用的充分性。
papers.title_zh: 实践中的DPI解决方案:基准和比较

papers.title: Revisiting the Pervasiveness of Weak Keys in Network Devices
papers.authors: Philippe Elbaz-Vincent, Mohamed Traoré
papers.abstract: Since 2012, several academic teams reported vulnerabilities in the RSA keys of HTTPS hosts on the Internet and traced the issue to several weaknesses. In 2016, a complementary study measured the actions taken by vendors and end users over time in response to the original disclosure by analyzing a large set of RSA moduli and discovered that RSA weak keys were still widespread with almost no action taken by the vendors. In this paper, we have reappraised their investigations with a focus on larger RSA moduli (2048 bits) and attempted to provide complementary analysis on some unexpected anomalies.
papers.abstract_zh: 自2012年以来，几个学术团队报告了互联网上HTTPS主机的RSA密钥中的漏洞，并追踪该问题到几个弱点。2016年，一项补充研究通过分析大量RSA模数，测量了供应商和最终用户随时间推移采取的响应原始披露的行动，并发现RSA弱密钥仍然普遍存在，供应商几乎没有采取任何行动。在本文中，我们重新评估了他们的研究，重点是更大的RSA模数(2048位)，并试图对一些意想不到的异常提供补充分析。
papers.title_zh: 重新审视网络设备中弱密钥的普遍性

papers.title: Innocent Until Proven Guilty (IUPG): Building Deep Learning Models with Embedded Robustness to Out-Of-Distribution Content
papers.authors: Brody Kutt, William Hewlett, Oleksii Starov, Yuchen Zhou
papers.abstract: Deep Neural Network classifiers trained with the conventional Categorical Cross-Entropy loss face problems in real-world environments such as a tendency to produce overly confident posterior distributions on out-of-distribution inputs, sensitivity to adversarial noise, and lost performance due to distributional shift. We hypothesize that a central shortcoming -an inability to effectively process out-of-distribution content within inputs-exacerbates each of these setbacks. In response, we propose a novel learning framework called Innocent Until Proven Guilty which prototypes training data clusters or classes within the input space while uniquely leveraging noise and inherently random classes to discover noise-resistant, uniquely identifiable features of the modeled classes. In evaluation, we leverage both academic computer vision datasets and realworld JavaScript and URL datasets for malware classification. Across these interdisciplinary settings, we observe favorable classification performance on test data, decreased loss of performance due to recency bias, decreased false-positive responses on noise samples, and decreased vulnerability in several noisebased attack simulations when compared to a baseline network of equal topology trained with Categorical Cross-Entropy. To the best of our knowledge, ours is the first work that demonstrates significantly decreased vulnerability to blackbox append attacks on malware. By applying the well-known FastGradient Sign Method, we show the potential to combine our framework with existing adversarial learning techniques and discover favorable performance by a significant margin. Our framework is general enough for use with any network topology that could otherwise be trained with Categorical Cross-Entropy.
papers.abstract_zh: 用传统的分类交叉熵损失训练的深度神经网络分类器在现实世界环境中面临问题，例如在分布外输入上产生过度自信的后验分布的趋势，对敌对噪声的敏感性，以及由于分布变化造成的性能损失。我们假设一个主要的缺点——无法有效地处理输入中的分发内容——加剧了这些挫折。作为回应，我们提出了一种新的学习框架，称为无罪，直到被证明有罪，它在输入空间内对训练数据集群或类进行原型化，同时独特地利用噪声和固有的随机类来发现建模类的抗噪声、唯一可识别的特征。在评估中，我们利用学术计算机视觉数据集和真实世界JavaScript和URL数据集进行恶意软件分类。在这些跨学科的设置中，我们观察到在测试数据上良好的分类性能，减少了由于最近偏差造成的性能损失，减少了对噪声样本的假阳性响应，并且与使用分类交叉熵训练的相等拓扑的基线网络相比，减少了在几个基于噪声的攻击模拟中的脆弱性。据我们所知，我们的工作是第一个证明了对恶意软件的黑盒附加攻击的脆弱性显著降低的工作。通过应用众所周知的快速梯度符号方法，我们展示了将我们的框架与现有的对抗性学习技术相结合的潜力，并发现了显著的有利性能。我们的框架足够通用于任何网络拓扑，否则可以用分类交叉熵来训练。
papers.title_zh: 无罪直到被证明有罪(IUPG):构建深度学习模型，嵌入对分发外内容的鲁棒性

papers.title: SAFELearn: Secure Aggregation for private FEderated Learning
papers.authors: Hossein Fereidooni, Samuel Marchal, Markus Miettinen, Azalia Mirhoseini, Helen Möllering, Thien Duc Nguyen, Phillip Rieger, Ahmad-Reza Sadeghi, Thomas Schneider, Hossein Yalame, Shaza Zeitouni
papers.abstract: Federated learning (FL) is an emerging distributed machine learning paradigm which addresses critical data privacy issues in machine learning by enabling clients, using an aggregation server (aggregator), to jointly train a global model without revealing their training data. Thereby, it improves not only privacy but is also efficient as it uses the computation power and data of potentially millions of clients for training in parallel. However, FL is vulnerable to so-called inference attacks by malicious aggregators which can infer information about clients’ data from their model updates. Secure aggregation restricts the central aggregator to only learn the summation or average of the updates of clients. Unfortunately, existing protocols for secure aggregation for FL suffer from high communication, computation, and many communication rounds.In this work, we present SAFELearn, a generic design for efficient private FL systems that protects against inference attacks that have to analyze individual clients’ model updates using secure aggregation. It is flexibly adaptable to the efficiency and security requirements of various FL applications and can be instantiated with MPC or FHE. In contrast to previous works, we only need 2 rounds of communication in each training iteration, do not use any expensive cryptographic primitives on clients, tolerate dropouts, and do not rely on a trusted third party. We implement and benchmark an instantiation of our generic design with secure two-party computation. Our implementation aggregates 500 models with more than 300K parameters in less than 0.5 seconds.
papers.abstract_zh: 联合学习(FL)是一种新兴的分布式机器学习范式，它通过使客户端能够使用聚合服务器(聚合器)来联合训练全局模型而不暴露其训练数据，从而解决机器学习中的关键数据隐私问题。因此，它不仅提高了隐私性，而且是高效的，因为它使用潜在的数百万客户端的计算能力和数据来并行训练。然而，FL容易受到恶意聚合器的所谓推断攻击，这些恶意聚合器可以从它们的模型更新中推断出关于客户数据的信息。安全聚合将中央聚合器限制为仅了解客户端更新的总和或平均值。不幸的是，用于FL的安全聚合的现有协议遭受高通信、计算和许多通信回合。在这项工作中，我们提出了SAFELearn，这是一种有效的私有FL系统的通用设计，可以防止推断攻击，这种攻击必须使用安全聚合来分析单个客户端的模型更新。它可以灵活地适应各种FL应用程序的效率和安全性要求，并且可以用MPC或FHE进行实例化。与以前的工作相比，我们在每次训练迭代中只需要2轮通信，不在客户端使用任何昂贵的密码原语，容忍丢失，并且不依赖可信第三方。我们用安全的两方计算实现并测试了通用设计的实例化。我们的实现在不到0.5秒的时间内聚合了500个模型和超过30万个参数。
papers.title_zh: SAFELearn:私有联合学习的安全聚合

papers.title: Applying Deep Learning to Combat Mass Robocalls
papers.authors: Sharbani Pandit, Jienan Liu, Roberto Perdisci, Mustaque Ahamad
papers.abstract: Mass robocalls affect millions of people on a daily basis. Unfortunately, most current defenses against robocalls rely on phone blocklists and are ineffective against caller ID spoofing. To enable detection and blocking of spoofed robocalls, we propose a deep learning based virtual assistant application for smartphones to automatically vet incoming calls. Similar to a human assistant, the virtual assistant can pick up an incoming call and screen it with deep learning modules without user interruption to determine if the call is unwanted. We show that our system can block unwanted mass robocalls and preserve the user experience of a phone call.
papers.abstract_zh: 大量的机器人电话每天影响着数百万人。不幸的是，目前大多数针对robocalls的防御措施都依赖于电话黑名单，并且对呼叫者ID欺骗无效。为了能够检测和阻止假冒的机器人电话，我们提出了一种基于深度学习的智能手机虚拟助理应用程序，以自动审查来电。与人类助理类似，虚拟助理可以接听来电，并在没有用户干扰的情况下使用深度学习模块进行筛选，以确定该电话是否是不想要的。我们表明，我们的系统可以阻止不必要的大量机器人呼叫，并保留电话呼叫的用户体验。
papers.title_zh: 应用深度学习对抗大规模机器人呼叫

papers.title: MMGuard: Automatically Protecting On-Device Deep Learning Models in Android Apps
papers.authors: Jiayi Hua, Yuanchun Li, Haoyu Wang
papers.abstract: On-device deep learning models have shown growing popularity in mobile apps, which allows offline model inference while preserving user privacy. However, on-device deep learning models also introduce security challenges, i.e., the trained models can be easily stolen or even be tampered by attackers. Recent studies suggested that most of the on-device models are lacking of sufficient protection, i.e., can be stolen by decompiling the apps directly. In this work, we present MMGUARD, an automated framework for building mutual authentication between Android apps and deep neural network models, which can thus protect on-device models from being easily attacked (piracy and tampering). Unlike existing model protect methods, our approach does not require model re-training or any prior knowledge of the training data. The key idea of MMGUARD is to verify the deep learning model in the app before inference, i.e., feeding owner- and apprelated information to it, which can greatly increase the effort of model hacking. We evaluate MMGUARD on 5 popular image classification DNNs and 43 real world Android apps from Google Play. Experiment results suggest that MMGUARD introduces negligible latency on models and can be automatically applied to real world apps.
papers.abstract_zh: 设备上的深度学习模型在移动应用程序中显示出越来越受欢迎，这允许离线模型推断，同时保护用户隐私。然而，设备上的深度学习模型也带来了安全挑战，即训练好的模型很容易被攻击者窃取甚至篡改。最近的研究表明，大多数设备上的模型缺乏足够的保护，即可以通过直接反编译应用程序来窃取。在这项工作中，我们提出了MMGUARD，这是一个用于在Android应用程序和深度神经网络模型之间建立相互认证的自动化框架，因此可以保护设备上的模型免受攻击(盗版和篡改)。与现有的模型保护方法不同，我们的方法不需要模型重新训练或训练数据的任何先验知识。MMGUARD的关键思想是在推理之前验证app中的深度学习模型，即向其馈送所有者和被赞赏者的信息，这可以大大增加模型黑客的努力。我们在5个流行的图像分类dnn和43个来自Google Play的真实世界Android应用上评估了MMGUARD。实验结果表明，MMGUARD在模型上引入的延迟可以忽略不计，并且可以自动应用于现实世界的应用程序。
papers.title_zh: MMGuard:自动保护Android应用中的设备上深度学习模型

papers.title: BODMAS: An Open Dataset for Learning based Temporal Analysis of PE Malware
papers.authors: Limin Yang, Arridhana Ciptadi, Ihar Laziuk, Ali Ahmadzadeh, Gang Wang
papers.abstract: We describe and release an open PE malware dataset called BODMAS to facilitate research efforts in machine learning based malware analysis. By closely examining existing open PE malware datasets, we identified two missing capabilities (i.e., recent/timestamped malware samples, and well-curated family information), which have limited researchers’ ability to study pressing issues such as concept drift and malware family evolution. For these reasons, we release a new dataset to fill in the gaps. The BODMAS dataset contains 57,293 malware samples and 77,142 benign samples collected from August 2019 to September 2020, with carefully curated family information (581 families). We also perform a preliminary analysis to illustrate the impact of concept drift and discuss how this dataset can help to facilitate existing and future research efforts.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们描述并发布了一个名为BODMAS的开放PE恶意软件数据集，以促进基于机器学习的恶意软件分析的研究工作。通过仔细检查现有的开放PE恶意软件数据集，我们发现了两个缺失的功能(即，最近/有时间戳的恶意软件样本和精心策划的家族信息)，这限制了研究人员研究概念漂移和恶意软件家族进化等紧迫问题的能力。出于这些原因，我们发布了一个新的数据集来填补空白。BODMAS数据集包含2019年8月至2020年9月收集的57，293个恶意软件样本和77，142个良性样本，以及精心策划的家族信息(581个家族)。我们还进行了初步分析，以说明概念漂移的影响，并讨论了该数据集如何有助于促进现有和未来的研究工作。
papers.title_zh: BODMAS:基于学习的PE恶意软件时序分析开放数据集

papers.title: Binary Black-Box Attacks Against Static Malware Detectors with Reinforcement Learning in Discrete Action Spaces
papers.authors: Mohammadreza Ebrahimi, Jason Pacheco, Weifeng Li, James Lee Hu, Hsinchun Chen
papers.abstract: Recent machine learning- and deep learning-based static malware detectors have shown breakthrough performance in identifying unseen malware variants. As a result, they are increasingly being adopted to lower the cost of dynamic malware analysis and manual signature identification. Despite their success, studies have shown that they can be vulnerable to adversarial malware attacks, in which an adversary modifies a known malware executable subtly to fool the malware detector into recognizing it as a benign file. Recent studies have shown that automatically crafting these adversarial malware variants at scale is beneficial to improve the robustness of malware detectors. For conciseness, we refer to this process as Adversarial Malware example Generation (AMG). Most AMG methods rely on prior knowledge about the architecture or parameters of the detector, which is not often available in practice. Moreover, the majority of these methods are restricted to additive modifications that append contents to the malware executable without modifying its original content. In this study, we offer a novel Reinforcement Learning (RL) method, AMG-VAC, which extends Variational Actor-Critic (VAC) to non-continuous action spaces where modifications are inherently discrete. We evaluate the evasion performance of the proposed AMG-VAC on two reputable machine learning-based malware detectors. While the proposed method outperforms extant non-RL and RL-based AMG methods by statistically significant margins, we show that the obtained evasive action sequences are useful in shedding light on malware detectors’ vulnerabilities.
papers.abstract_zh: 最近基于机器学习和深度学习的静态恶意软件检测器在识别未知恶意软件变体方面表现出突破性的性能。因此，它们越来越多地被用来降低动态恶意软件分析和手动签名识别的成本。尽管它们取得了成功，但研究表明它们容易受到恶意软件的攻击，在这种攻击中，对手会巧妙地修改已知的恶意软件可执行文件，以欺骗恶意软件检测器将其识别为良性文件。最近的研究表明，大规模自动制造这些敌对的恶意软件变种有利于提高恶意软件检测器的鲁棒性。为简明起见，我们将这一过程称为敌对恶意软件示例生成(AMG)。大多数AMG方法依赖于关于检测机结构或参数的先验知识，而这在实践中并不常见。此外，这些方法中的大多数限于将内容附加到恶意软件可执行文件而不修改其原始内容的附加修改。在本研究中，我们提出了一种新的强化学习方法AMG-VAC，它将变分行动批评方法扩展到非连续行动空间，其中修改是固有离散的。我们在两个著名的基于机器学习的恶意软件检测器上评估了所提出的AMG-VAC的规避性能。虽然所提出的方法在统计上显著超过现有的非RL和基于RL的AMG方法，但我们表明，所获得的规避动作序列在揭示恶意软件检测器的漏洞方面是有用的。
papers.title_zh: 基于离散动作空间强化学习的静态恶意检测器二进制黑盒攻击

papers.title: Verbatim: A Verified Lexer Generator
papers.authors: Derek Egolf, Sam Lasser, Kathleen Fisher
papers.abstract: Lexers and parsers are often used as front ends to connect input from the outside world with th e internals of a larger software system. These front ends are natural targets for attackers who w ish to compromise the larger system. A formally verified tool that p erforms mechanized lexical analysis would render attacks on these front ends less effective. In this paper we present Verbatim, an executable lexer that is implemented and verified with th e Coq P ro o f Assistant. We prove that Verbatim is correct with respect to a standard lexer specification. We also analyze its theoretical com plexity and give results o f an em pirical performance evaluation. All correctness proofs have been mechanized in Coq.
papers.abstract_zh: 词法分析器和语法分析器经常被用作连接外部世界的输入和大型软件系统内部的前端。这些前端是想要危害更大系统的攻击者的天然目标。执行机械化词法分析的正式验证工具会降低对这些前端的攻击的有效性。在本文中，我们介绍了逐字，一个可执行的词法分析器，实现和验证的Coq P ro o f助理。我们证明逐字对于标准的lexer规范是正确的。我们还分析了它的理论复杂性，并给出了一个实际的性能评估结果。所有的正确性证明在Coq中都已经机械化了。
papers.title_zh: 逐字:一个经过验证的Lexer生成器

papers.title: Formal Language Theory for Practical Security - Extended Abstract -
papers.authors: Andreas Jakoby, Jannis Leuther, Stefan Lucks
papers.abstract: When binary data are sent from one party to another one, the encoding of the data can be described as a “data serialisation” language (DaSeL). Many DaSeLs employ the “length-prefix” pattern for strings, containers and other data items of variable length. This consists of an encoding of the item’s length, followed by an encoding of the item itself without closing brackets or “end” symbols. The receiver must determine the final byte from the length read before. Lengthprefix languages are not context-free. Thus, the plethora of tools and methods to specify, analyse, and parse context-free languages appears to be useless for length-prefix languages. This seems to explain why improper specffications of length-prefix languages and buggy hand-written parsers are so often a root cause for security issues and exploits, as, e.g., in the case of the famous Heartbleed bug. One might even be tempted to consider the use of length-prefix languages a security hazard. But this consideration would be wrong. We present a transformation of words from “calc-context-free” languages (a superset of context-free and length-prefix languages) into words from proper context-free languages. The transformation actually allows to use tools from context-free languages to deal with length-prefix languages. Our transformation runs on a Turing machine with logarithmic space. This implies the theoretical result of calc-context-free languages being in the complexity class log$C\mathcal{F}\mathcal{L}$. Similarly, deterministic calc-context-free languages are in log$\mathcal{D}\mathcal{C}\mathcal{F}\mathcal{L}$. To run in linear time, one needs to enhance the Turing machine by a stack to store additional data.
papers.abstract_zh: 当二进制数据从一方发送到另一方时，数据的编码可以描述为“数据序列化”语言(DaSeL)。许多数据库对字符串、容器和其它可变长度的数据项采用“长度前缀”模式。这包括项目长度的编码，随后是项目本身的编码，没有右括号或“结束”符号。接收器必须根据之前读取的长度确定最终字节。长度前缀语言不是上下文无关的。因此，大量用于指定、分析和解析上下文无关语言的工具和方法似乎对长度前缀语言毫无用处。这似乎解释了为什么不正确的长度前缀语言规范和错误的手写解析器经常是安全问题和漏洞的根本原因，例如著名的Heartbleed错误。人们甚至可能会认为长度前缀语言的使用是一种安全隐患。但是这种想法是错误的。我们提出了从“计算上下文无关”语言(上下文无关和长度前缀语言的超集)到适当上下文无关语言的单词的转换。这种转换实际上允许使用上下文无关语言的工具来处理长度前缀语言。我们的转换运行在一个具有对数空间的图灵机上。这意味着calc上下文无关语言的理论结果在复杂性类log$C\mathcal{F}\mathcal{L}$中。类似地，确定性的calc上下文无关语言在log $ \ mathcal { D } \ mathcal { C } \ mathcal { F } \ mathcal { L } $中。为了以线性时间运行，需要通过堆栈来增强图灵机，以存储额外的数据。
papers.title_zh: 实用安全的形式语言理论

papers.title: Formal Synthesis of Filter Components for Use in Security-Enhancing Architectural Transformations
papers.authors: David S. Hardin, Konrad L. Slind
papers.abstract: Safety- and security-critical developers have long recognized the importance of applying a high degree of scrutiny to a system’s (or subsystem’s) I/O messages. However, lack of care in the development of message-handling components can lead to an increase, rather than a decrease, in the attack surface. On the DARPA Cyber-Assured Systems Engineering (CASE) program, we have focused our research effort on identifying cyber vulnerabilities early in system development, in particular at the Architecture development phase, and then automatically synthesizing components that mitigate against the identified vulnerabilities from high-level specifications. This approach is highly compatible with the goals of the LangSec community. Advances in formal methods have allowed us to produce hardware/software implementations that are both performant and guaranteed correct. With these tools, we can synthesize high-assurance “building blocks” that can be composed automatically with high confidence to create trustworthy systems, using a method we call Security-Enhancing Architectural Transformations. Our synthesis-focused approach provides a higherleverage insertion point for formal methods than is possible with post facto analytic methods, as the formal methods tools directly contribute to the implementation of the system, without requiring developers to become formal methods experts. Our techniques encompass Systems, Hardware, and Software Development, as well as Hardware/Software Co-Design/CoAssurance. We illustrate our method and tools with an example that implements security-improving transformations on system architectures expressed using the Architecture Analysis and Design Language (AADL). We show how message-handling components can be synthesized from high-level regular or context-free language specifications, as well as a novel specification language for self-describing messages called Contiguity Types, and verified to meet arithmetic constraints extracted from the AADL model. Finally, we guarantee that the intent of the message processing logic is accurately reflected in the application binary code through the use of the verified CakeML compiler, in the case of software, or the Restricted Algorithmic C toolchain with ACL2-based formal verification, in the case of hardware/software co-design.
papers.abstract_zh: 安全和安全性关键的开发人员很早就认识到对系统(或子系统)的I/O消息进行高度审查的重要性。然而，在消息处理组件的开发中缺乏注意会导致攻击面的增加，而不是减少。在DARPA网络安全系统工程(CASE)项目中，我们将研究重点放在系统开发的早期识别网络漏洞上，特别是在架构开发阶段，然后自动合成组件，以减轻高级规范中识别出的漏洞。这种方法与LangSec社区的目标高度一致。形式化方法的进步已经允许我们生产出既有性能又保证正确的硬件/软件实现。有了这些工具，我们可以合成高度可靠的“构建块”,使用我们称之为增强安全性的体系结构转换的方法，这些“构建块”可以高度可靠地自动组合，以创建值得信赖的系统。我们的关注综合的方法为形式方法提供了比事后分析方法更高的平均插入点，因为形式方法工具直接有助于系统的实现，而不需要开发者成为形式方法专家。我们的技术涵盖系统、硬件和软件开发，以及硬件/软件协同设计/共同保险。我们用一个例子来说明我们的方法和工具，这个例子在用体系结构分析和设计语言(AADL)表达的系统体系结构上实现安全性改进转换。我们展示了如何从高级常规或上下文无关语言规范，以及一种称为邻接类型的自描述消息的新型规范语言中合成消息处理组件，并验证其满足从AADL模型中提取的算法约束。最后，在软件的情况下，我们保证通过使用经过验证的CakeML编译器，或者在硬件/软件协同设计的情况下，通过使用具有基于ACL2的形式验证的受限算法C工具链，消息处理逻辑的意图被准确地反映在应用二进制代码中。
papers.title_zh: 用于增强安全性的体系结构转换的过滤器组件的形式综合

papers.title: Research Report: Building a File Observatory for Secure Parser Development
papers.authors: Tim Allison, Wayne Burke, Chris Mattmann, Anastasija Mensikova, Philip Southam, Ryan Stonebraker
papers.abstract: Parsing untrusted data is notoriously challenging. Failure to handle maliciously crafted data correctly can (and does) lead to a wide range of vulnerabilities. The Language-theoretic security (LangSec) philosophy seeks to obviate the need for developers to apply ad hoc solutions by, instead, offering formally correct and verifiable input handling throughout the software development lifecycle. One of the key components in developing secure parsers is a broad coverage corpus that enables developers to understand the problem space for a given format and to use, potentially, as seeds for fuzzing and other automated testing. In this paper, we offer an update on work initially reported at the LangSec 2020 conference on the development of a file observatory to gather and enable analysis on a diverse collection of files at scale. The initial focus of the observatory is on Portable Document Format (PDF) files and file formats typically embedded in PDFs. In this paper, we report on the addition of a bug tracker corpus and new analytic methods.
papers.abstract_zh: 众所周知，解析不受信任的数据极具挑战性。未能正确处理恶意制作的数据会(并且确实会)导致各种各样的漏洞。语言理论安全(LangSec)哲学试图通过在整个软件开发生命周期中提供形式上正确且可验证的输入处理，来消除开发人员应用特定解决方案的需要。开发安全解析器的一个关键组件是一个覆盖面广的语料库，它使开发人员能够理解给定格式的问题空间，并潜在地用作模糊化和其他自动化测试的种子。在本文中，我们提供了LangSec 2020会议上最初报告的关于开发文件观测站的工作的更新，以收集和分析大规模的多样化文件集合。观察站最初的重点是可移植文档格式(PDF)文件和通常嵌入PDF的文件格式。在本文中，我们报告了一个bug追踪器语料库的添加和新的分析方法。
papers.title_zh: 研究报告:为安全解析器开发构建一个文件观察站

papers.title: Research Report: Parsing PEGs with Length Fields in Software and Hardware
papers.authors: Zephyr S. Lucas, Joanna Y. Liu, Prashant Anantharaman, Sean W. Smith
papers.abstract: Since parsers are the line of defense between binaries and untrusted data, they are some of the most common sources of vulnerabilities in software. Language-Theoretic Security provides an approach to implement hardened parsers. We specify the binary format as a formal grammar and implement a recognizer for this formal grammar. However, most binary formats use constructs such as the length field, repeat field, and an offset instruction. Most grammar formats do not support these features. Building on PEGs and calc-regular languages, we propose Calc-Parsing Expression Grammars (Calc-PEGs), a formalization of parsing expression grammars that supports the length field. We design an algorithm to parse Calc-PEGs in $O(n^{2})$ time and a parallel algorithm to parse Calc-PEGs in O(n) time. We also present Pegmatite, a tool to generate these parsers in C, with an option to generate VHDL code.
papers.abstract_zh: 因为解析器是二进制文件和不可信数据之间的防线，所以它们是软件中一些最常见的漏洞来源。语言理论安全性提供了一种实现强化解析器的方法。我们将二进制格式指定为一种形式语法，并为这种形式语法实现了一个识别器。然而，大多数二进制格式使用诸如长度字段、重复字段和偏移指令之类的结构。大多数语法格式不支持这些特性。基于PEGs和calc-regular语言，我们提出了Calc-Parsing表达式文法(Calc-PEGs)，这是一种支持长度字段的解析表达式文法的形式化。我们设计了一个在$O(n^{2})$时间内解析calc-peg的算法和一个在O(n)时间内解析calc-peg的并行算法。我们还展示了一个用C语言生成这些解析器的工具Pegmatite，它带有一个生成VHDL代码的选项。
papers.title_zh: 研究报告:在软件和硬件中解析带有长度字段的peg

papers.title: Formal Languages, Deep Learning, Topology and AlgebraicWord Problems
papers.authors: Joshua Ackerman, George Cybenko
papers.abstract: This paper describes relationships between various state-of-the-art neural network architectures and formal languages as, for example, structured by the Chomsky Language Hierarchy. Of particular interest are the abilities of a neural architecture to represent, recognize and generate words from a specific language by learning from positive and negative samples of words in the language. Of specific interest are some relationships between languages, networks and topology that we outline analytically and explore through several illustrative experiments. By specifically comparing analytic results relating formal languages to topology via algebraic word problems with empirical results based on neural networks and persistent homology calculations, we see evidence that certain observed topological properties match analytically predicted properties. Such results are encouraging for understanding the role that modern machine learning can play in formal language processing problems.
papers.abstract_zh: 本文描述了各种最新的神经网络体系结构和形式语言之间的关系，例如，由乔姆斯基语言层次结构。特别令人感兴趣的是神经结构通过从语言中单词的正样本和负样本中学习来表示、识别和生成来自特定语言的单词的能力。特别感兴趣的是语言、网络和拓扑之间的一些关系，我们通过几个说明性的实验来分析和探索这些关系。通过将通过代数文字问题将形式语言与拓扑相关联的分析结果与基于神经网络和持续同源计算的经验结果进行具体比较，我们看到了某些观察到的拓扑性质与分析预测的性质相匹配的证据。这些结果对于理解现代机器学习在形式语言处理问题中的作用是令人鼓舞的。
papers.title_zh: 形式语言、深度学习、拓扑和代数单词问题

papers.title: Accessible Formal Methods for Verified Parser Development
papers.authors: Letitia W. Li, Greg Eakman, Elias J. M. Garcia, Sam Atman
papers.abstract: Security flaws in Portable Document Format (PDF) readers may allow PDFs to conceal malware, exfiltrate information, and execute malicious code. For a PDF reader to identify these flawed PDFs requires first parsing the document syntactically, and then analyzing the semantic properties or structure of the parse result. This paper presents a language theoretic and developer-accessible approach to PDF parsing and validation using ACL2, a formal methods language and theorem prover. We develop two related components, a PDF syntax parser and a semantic validator. The ACL2-based parser, verified using the theorem prover, supports verification of a high-performance equivalent of itself or an existing PDF parser. The validator then extends the existing parser by checking the semantic properties in the parse result. The structure of the parser and semantic rules are defined by the PDF grammar and fall into certain patterns, and therefore can be automatically composed from a set of verified base functions. Instead of requiring a developer to be familiar with formal methods and to manually write ACL2 code, we use Tower, our modular metalanguage, to generate verified ACL2 functions and proofs and the equivalent C code to analyze semantic properties, which can then be integrated into our verified parser or an existing parser to support PDF validation.
papers.abstract_zh: 可移植文档格式(PDF)阅读器中的安全缺陷可能允许PDF隐藏恶意软件、泄露信息和执行恶意代码。对于PDF阅读器来说，识别这些有缺陷的PDF需要首先从语法上解析文档，然后分析解析结果的语义属性或结构。本文提出了一种语言理论和开发人员可访问的方法，使用ACL2进行PDF解析和验证，ACL 2是一种形式方法语言和定理证明器。我们开发了两个相关的组件，一个PDF语法解析器和一个语义验证器。基于ACL2的解析器，使用定理证明器进行验证，支持验证其自身或现有PDF解析器的高性能等价物。然后，验证器通过检查解析结果中的语义属性来扩展现有的解析器。解析器的结构和语义规则是由PDF语法定义的，属于特定的模式，因此可以由一组经过验证的基本函数自动组成。我们不需要开发人员熟悉正式方法并手动编写ACL2代码，而是使用我们的模块化元语言Tower来生成经过验证的ACL2函数和证明以及等效的C代码来分析语义属性，然后可以将这些代码集成到我们经过验证的解析器或现有解析器中，以支持PDF验证。
papers.title_zh: 用于验证解析器开发的可访问的形式化方法

papers.title: Differential analysis of x86-64 instruction decoders
papers.authors: William Woodruff, Niki Carroll, Sebastiaan Peters
papers.abstract: Differential fuzzing replaces traditional fuzzer oracles like crashes, hangs, unsound memory accesses with a difference oracle, where an implementation of a specification is said to be potentially erroneous if its behavior differs from another implementation’s on the same input. Differential fuzzing has been applied successfully to cryptography software and complex application format parsers like PDF and ELF.This paper describes the application of differential fuzzing to x86-64 instruction decoders for bug discovery. It introduces MISHEGOS, a novel differential fuzzer that discovers decoding discrepancies between instruction decoders. We describe MiSHEGos’s architecture and approach to error discovery, as well as the security implications of decoding errors and discrepancies. We also describe a novel fuzzing strategy for instruction decoders on variable-length architectures based on sliding through an overapproximated model of machine instructions.MISHEGOS produces hundreds of millions of decoder tests per hour on modest hardware. We have used MISHEGOS to discover hundreds of errors in popular x86-64 instruction decoders without relying on a hardware decoder for ground truth. MISHEGOS includes an extensible framework for analyzing the results of a fuzzing campaign, allowing users to discover errors in a single decoder or a variety of discrepancies between multiple decoders. We provide access to MISHEGOS’S source code under a permissive license.
papers.abstract_zh: 差分模糊化用差分模糊化取代了传统的模糊化预言，如崩溃、挂起、不健全的内存访问，在差分模糊化中，如果一个规范的实现的行为与另一个实现在相同输入上的行为不同，则该规范的实现被称为潜在错误。差分模糊已经成功地应用于密码软件和复杂的应用格式解析器，如PDF和ELF。描述了差分模糊化在x86-64指令解码器中的应用。它介绍了MISHEGOS，一种新的差分模糊器，可以发现指令解码器之间的解码差异。我们描述了MiSHEGos的架构和错误发现方法，以及解码错误和差异的安全含义。我们还描述了一种新的模糊化策略，该策略基于滑动过逼近的机器指令模型，用于可变长度体系结构上的指令解码器。MISHEGOS在普通的硬件上每小时可以进行数亿次解码器测试。我们已经使用MISHEGOS在流行的x86-64指令解码器中发现了数百个错误，而不依赖硬件解码器来获得基本事实。MISHEGOS包括一个用于分析模糊活动结果的可扩展框架，允许用户发现单个解码器中的错误或多个解码器之间的各种差异。我们根据许可协议提供对MISHEGOS源代码的访问。
papers.title_zh: x86-64指令译码器的差分分析

papers.title: Bohemia - A Validator for Parser Frameworks
papers.authors: Anish Paranjpe, Gang Tan
papers.abstract: Parsing is ubiquitous in software projects, ranging from small command-line utilities, highly secure network clients, to large compilers. Programmers are provided with a plethora of parsing libraries to choose from. However, implementation bugs in parsing libraries allow the generation of incorrect parsers, which in turn may allow malicious inputs to crash systems or launch security exploits. In this paper we describe a lightweight validation framework called Bohemia that a parsing library developer can use as a tool in a toolkit for integration testing. The framework makes use of the concept of Equivalence Modulo Inputs (EMI) in order to generate mutated input grammars to stress test the parsing library. We also describe the result of evaluating Bohemia with a set of parsing libraries that utilize distinct parsing algorithms. During the evaluation, we found a number of bugs in those libraries. Some of those have been reported to and fixed by developers.
papers.abstract_zh: 解析在软件项目中无处不在，从小型命令行实用程序、高度安全的网络客户端到大型编译器。程序员有大量的解析库可供选择。然而，解析库中的实现错误允许生成不正确的解析器，这反过来又可能允许恶意输入使系统崩溃或发起安全攻击。在本文中，我们描述了一个名为Bohemia的轻量级验证框架，解析库开发人员可以将其用作集成测试工具包中的一个工具。该框架利用等价模输入(EMI)的概念来生成变异的输入语法，以对解析库进行压力测试。我们还描述了用一组利用不同解析算法的解析库评估Bohemia的结果。在评估过程中，我们在那些库中发现了一些错误。有些问题已经报告给了开发人员并由他们解决了。
papers.title_zh: Bohemia——解析器框架的验证器

papers.title: RL-GRIT: Reinforcement Learning for Grammar Inference
papers.authors: Walt Woods
papers.abstract: When working to understand usage of a data format, examples of the data format are often more representative than the format’s specification. For example, two different applications might use very different JSON representations, or two PDF-writing applications might make use of very different areas of the PDF specification to realize the same rendered content. The complexity arising from these distinct origins can lead to large, difficult-to-understand attack surfaces, presenting a security concern when considering both exfiltration and data schizophrenia. Grammar inference can aid in describing the practical language generator behind examples of a data format. However, most grammar inference research focuses on natural language, not data formats, and fails to support crucial features such as type recursion. We propose a novel set of mechanisms for grammar inference, RL-GRIT1, and apply them to understanding de facto data formats. After reviewing existing grammar inference solutions, it was determined that a new, more flexible scaffold could be found in Reinforcement Learning (RL). Within this work, we lay out the many algorithmic changes required to adapt RL from its traditional, sequential-time environment to the highly interdependent environment of parsing. The result is an algorithm which can demonstrably learn recursive control structures in simple data formats, and can extract meaningful structure from fragments of the PDF format. Whereas prior work in grammar inference focused on either regular languages or constituency parsing, we show that RL can be used to surpass the expressiveness of both classes, and offers a clear path to learning context-sensitive languages. The proposed algorithm can serve as a building block for understanding the ecosystems of de facto data formats.1RL-GRIT may be pronounced as “Real Grit.”
papers.abstract_zh: 在努力理解数据格式的用法时，数据格式的例子通常比格式的规范更有代表性。例如，两个不同的应用程序可能使用非常不同的JSON表示，或者两个编写PDF的应用程序可能使用非常不同的PDF规范来实现相同的呈现内容。这些不同来源带来的复杂性可能会导致难以理解的大型攻击面，在考虑渗透和数据分裂时会带来安全问题。语法推理有助于描述数据格式示例背后的实用语言生成器。然而，大多数语法推理研究集中于自然语言，而不是数据格式，并且未能支持诸如类型递归之类的关键特性。我们提出了一套新的语法推理机制，RL-GRIT1，并应用它们来理解事实数据格式。在回顾了现有的语法推理解决方案后，我们确定可以在强化学习(RL)中找到一种新的、更灵活的支架。在这项工作中，我们列出了将RL从传统的时序环境调整到高度相互依赖的解析环境所需的许多算法变化。其结果是一种算法，该算法可以明显地学习简单数据格式中的递归控制结构，并且可以从PDF格式的片段中提取有意义的结构。虽然以前的语法推理工作集中在正则语言或成分分析上，但我们表明RL可以用来超越这两个类的表达能力，并为学习上下文敏感的语言提供了一条清晰的道路。所提出的算法可以作为理解事实数据格式生态系统的构建模块。1RL-GRIT可以读作“真正的砂砾”
papers.title_zh: RL-GRIT:语法推理的强化学习

papers.title: Looking for non-compliant documents using error messages from multiple parsers
papers.authors: Michael Robinson
papers.abstract: Whether a file is accepted by a single parser is not a reliable indication of whether a file complies with its stated format and presents minimal risk to the user. Bugs within both the parser and the format specification mean that a compliant file may fail to parse, or that a non-compliant file might be read without any apparent trouble. The latter situation presents a significant security risk, and should be avoided. This paper suggests that a better way to assess format specification compliance is to examine the set of error messages produced by a set of parsers rather than a single parser. If both a sample of compliant files and a sample of non-compliant files are available, then we show how a statistical test based on a pseudo-likelihood ratio can be very effective at determining a file’s compliance and safety. Our method is format agnostic, and does not directly rely upon a formal specification of the format. Although this paper focuses upon the case of the PDF format (ISO 32000-2), we make no attempt to use any specific details of the format. Furthermore, we show how principal components analysis can be useful for a format specification designer to assess the quality and structure of these samples of files and parsers. While these tests are absolutely rudimentary, it appears that their use to measure file format variability and to identify non-compliant files is both novel and surprisingly effective.
papers.abstract_zh: 文件是否被单个解析器接受并不能可靠地表明文件是否符合其规定的格式，并且对用户的风险最小。解析器和格式规范中的错误意味着一个兼容的文件可能无法解析，或者一个不兼容的文件可能被顺利读取。后一种情况存在很大的安全风险，应该避免。本文建议，评估格式规范符合性的更好方法是检查由一组解析器而不是单个解析器产生的一组错误消息。如果合规文件样本和不合规文件样本都可用，那么我们将展示基于伪似然比的统计测试如何能够非常有效地确定文件的合规性和安全性。我们的方法是格式不可知的，并且不直接依赖于格式的正式规范。尽管本文主要关注PDF格式(ISO 32000-2)的情况，但我们并不试图使用该格式的任何具体细节。此外，我们还展示了主成分分析如何有助于格式规范设计者评估这些文件和解析器样本的质量和结构。虽然这些测试绝对是初级的，但它们用于测量文件格式的可变性和识别不兼容的文件似乎既新颖又惊人地有效。
papers.title_zh: 使用来自多个解析器的错误消息查找不兼容的文档

papers.title: Mechanized Type Safety for Gradual Information Flow
papers.authors: Tianyu Chen, Jeremy G. Siek
papers.abstract: We model a security-typed language with gradual information flow labels in a proof assistant, demonstrate its potential application to parsing and securing sensitive user input data, present the semantics as a definitional interpreter, and prove type safety. We compare the language features and properties of various existing gradual security-typed languages, shedding light on future designs.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们在proof assistant中使用渐进信息流标签对安全类型语言进行建模，展示其在解析和保护敏感用户输入数据方面的潜在应用，将语义作为定义解释器进行呈现，并证明类型安全。我们比较了各种现有的渐进安全类型语言的语言特性和属性，为未来的设计提供了启示。
papers.title_zh: 渐进式信息流的机械化安全

papers.title: Alexa in Phishingland: Empirical Assessment of Susceptibility to Phishing Pretexting in Voice Assistant Environments
papers.authors: Filipo Sharevski, Peter Jachim
papers.abstract: This paper investigates what cues people use to spot a phishing email when the email is spoken back to them by the Alexa voice assistant, instead of read on a screen. We configured Alexa to read there emails to a sample of 52 participants and ask for their phishing evaluations. We also asked a control group of another 52 participants to evaluate these emails on a regular screen to compare the plausibility of phishing pretexting in voice assistant environments. The results suggest that Alexa can be used for pretexting users that lack phishing awareness to receive and act upon a relatively urgent email from an authoritative sender. Inspecting the sender (authority cue”) and relying on their personal experiences helped participants with higher phishing awareness to use Alexa towards a preliminary email screening to flag an email as potentially “phishing.”
papers.abstract_zh: 本文调查了当电子邮件由Alexa语音助手复述给他们而不是在屏幕上阅读时，人们使用什么线索来识别钓鱼电子邮件。我们将Alexa配置为读取52名参与者的电子邮件样本，并询问他们对网络钓鱼的评估。我们还要求由另外52名参与者组成的控制组在常规屏幕上评估这些电子邮件，以比较语音助手环境中网络钓鱼伪装的可能性。结果表明，Alexa可以用于伪装缺乏网络钓鱼意识的用户，以接收和处理来自权威发件人的相对紧急的电子邮件。检查发件人(权威提示)并依靠他们的个人经验，帮助具有较高网络钓鱼意识的参与者使用Alexa进行初步的电子邮件筛选，以将电子邮件标记为潜在的“网络钓鱼”。"
papers.title_zh: 网络钓鱼中的Alexa:对语音助手环境中网络钓鱼伪装易感性的实证评估

papers.title: BLEKeeper: Response Time Behavior Based Man-In-The-Middle Attack Detection
papers.authors: Muhammed Ali Yurdagul, Husrev Taha Sencar
papers.abstract: Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) has become one of the most popular wireless communication protocols and is used in billions of smart devices. Despite several security features, the hardware and software limitations of these devices makes them vulnerable to man-in-the-middle (MITM) attacks. Due to the use of these devices in increasingly diverse and safety-critical applications, the capability to detect MITM attacks has become more critical. To address this challenge, we propose the use of the response time behavior of a BLE device observed in relation to select read and write operations and introduce an active MITM attack detection system that identifies changes in response time. Our measurements on several BLE devices show that their response time behavior exhibits very high regularity, making it a very reliable attack indicator that cannot be concealed by an attacker. Test results show that our system can very accurately and quickly detect MITM attacks while requiring a simple learning approach.
papers.abstract_zh: 蓝牙低能耗(BLE)已成为最流行的无线通信协议之一，用于数十亿台智能设备。尽管有一些安全功能，这些设备的硬件和软件限制使它们容易受到中间人(MITM)攻击。由于这些设备在日益多样化和安全关键的应用中的使用，检测MITM攻击的能力变得更加重要。为了应对这一挑战，我们建议使用与选择读取和写入操作相关的BLE设备的响应时间行为，并引入主动MITM攻击检测系统来识别响应时间的变化。我们对几个BLE设备的测量表明，它们的响应时间行为表现出非常高的规律性，这使得它成为一个非常可靠的攻击指标，不能被攻击者隐藏。测试结果表明，我们的系统可以非常准确和快速地检测MITM攻击，同时需要一个简单的学习方法。
papers.title_zh: BLEKeeper:基于响应时间行为的中间人攻击检测

papers.title: LIRA-V: Lightweight Remote Attestation for Constrained RISC-V Devices
papers.authors: Carlton Shepherd, Konstantinos Markantonakis, Georges-Axel Jaloyan
papers.abstract: This paper presents LIRA-V, a lightweight system for performing remote attestation between constrained devices using the RISC-V architecture. We propose using read-only memory and the RISC-V Physical Memory Protection (PMP) primitive to build a trust anchor for remote attestation and secure channel creation. Moreover, we show how LIRA-V can be used for trusted communication between two devices using mutual attestation. We present the design, implementation and evaluation of LIRA-V using an off-the-shelf RISC-V microcontroller and present performance results to demonstrate its suitability. To our knowledge, we present the first remote attestation mechanism suitable for constrained RISC-V devices, with applications to cyber-physical systems and Internet of Things (IoT) devices.
papers.abstract_zh: 本文介绍了LIRA-V，它是一个轻量级系统，使用RISC-V体系结构在受限设备之间执行远程证明。我们建议使用只读存储器和RISC-V物理内存保护(PMP)原语来构建用于远程证明和安全通道创建的信任锚。此外，我们展示了LIRA-V如何用于两个设备之间使用相互证明的可信通信。我们介绍了使用现成RISC-V微控制器的LIRA-V的设计、实现和评估，并介绍了性能结果以证明其适用性。据我们所知，我们提出了第一个适用于受限RISC-V设备的远程证明机制，并应用于信息物理系统和物联网(IoT)设备。
papers.title_zh: LIRA-V:用于受限RISC-V设备的轻量级远程证明

papers.title: HybriDiagnostics: Evaluating Security Issues in Hybrid SmartHome Companion Apps
papers.authors: Abhinav Mohanty, Meera Sridhar
papers.abstract: This work presents HybriDiagnostics, a vulnerability-assessment framework that identifies nine preexisting security issues in IoT companion apps built using hybrid app development frameworks. At the heart of HybriDiagnostics is an analysis engine that identifies misconfigured policies (including Content Security Policy, and whitelist), usage of inline scripts, unsafe eval() usage, unsafe HTML and JQuery APIs and attributes, unencrypted storage, usage of vulnerable Cordova SDKs and more. The results of the analyses are documented in a security assessment report.A set of 102 Apache Cordova, Ionic, Monaca, OnsenUI, Phonegap, and Framework7 smarthome apps are analyzed to identify the security issues. For each security issue, either a proofof-concept attack or a hypothetical attack scenario is presented to demonstrate how the issue can be exploited to launch a serious cyberattack against the companion IoT device or the smartphone itself and compromise user privacy.
papers.abstract_zh: 这项工作提出了HybriDiagnostics，这是一个漏洞评估框架，可以识别使用混合应用程序开发框架构建的物联网配套应用程序中预先存在的九个安全问题。HybriDiagnostics的核心是一个分析引擎，它可以识别错误配置的策略(包括内容安全策略和白名单)、内联脚本的使用、不安全的eval()使用、不安全的HTML和JQuery APIs和属性、未加密的存储、易受攻击的Cordova SDKs的使用等等。分析结果记录在安全评估报告中。分析了一组102个Apache Cordova、Ionic、Monaca、OnsenUI、Phonegap和Framework7智能家居应用程序，以确定安全问题。对于每个安全问题，都提供了一个概念验证攻击或一个假设的攻击场景，以展示如何利用该问题对配套的物联网设备或智能手机本身发起严重的网络攻击，并危及用户隐私。
papers.title_zh: 混合诊断学:评估混合智能家居伴侣应用中的安全问题

papers.title: On the Safety Implications of Misordered Events and Commands in IoT Systems
papers.authors: Furkan Göksel, Muslum Ozgur Ozmen, Michael Reeves, Basavesh Shivakumar, Z. Berkay Celik
papers.abstract: IoT devices, equipped with embedded actuators and sensors, provide custom automation in the form of IoT apps. IoT apps subscribe to events and upon receipt, transmit actuation commands which trigger a set of actuators. Events and actuation commands follow paths in the IoT ecosystem such as sensor-toedge, edge-to-cloud, and cloud-to-actuator, with different network and processing delays between these connections. Significant delays may occur especially when an IoT system cloud interacts with other clouds. Due to this variation in delays, the cloud may receive events in an incorrect order, and in turn, devices may receive and actuate misordered commands. In this paper, we first study eight major IoT platforms and show that they do not make strong guarantees on event orderings to address these issues. We then analyze the end-to-end interactions among IoT components, from the creation of an event to the invocation of a command. From this, we identify and formalize the root causes of misorderings in events and commands leading to undesired states. We deploy 23 apps in a simulated smart home containing 35 IoT devices to evaluate the misordering problem. Our experiments demonstrate a high number of misordered events and commands that occur through different interaction paths. Through this effort, we reveal the root and extent of the misordering problem and guide future work to ensure correct ordering in IoT systems.
papers.abstract_zh: 配有嵌入式执行器和传感器的物联网设备以物联网应用的形式提供定制自动化。物联网应用订阅事件，并在收到事件后，传输触发一组执行器的驱动命令。事件和驱动命令遵循物联网生态系统中的路径，如传感器到边缘、边缘到云以及云到致动器，这些连接之间存在不同的网络和处理延迟。特别是当物联网系统云与其他云交互时，可能会出现明显的延迟。由于延迟的这种变化，云可能以不正确的顺序接收事件，并且反过来，设备可能接收和执行混乱的命令。在本文中，我们首先研究了八个主要的物联网平台，并表明它们没有对事件排序做出强有力的保证来解决这些问题。然后，我们分析物联网组件之间的端到端交互，从事件的创建到命令的调用。由此，我们确定并形式化了导致不期望状态的事件和命令中的混乱的根本原因。我们在一个包含35个物联网设备的模拟智能家庭中部署了23个应用程序，以评估乱序问题。我们的实验展示了通过不同交互路径出现的大量无序事件和命令。通过这一努力，我们揭示了乱序问题的根源和程度，并指导未来的工作，以确保物联网系统中的正确排序。
papers.title_zh: 物联网系统中无序事件和命令的安全含义

papers.title: Demo: Attacking Multi-Sensor Fusion based Localization in High-Level Autonomous Driving
papers.authors: Junjie Shen, Jun Yeon Won, Zeyuan Chen, Qi Alfred Chen
papers.abstract: To enable high-level driving automation [1], the Autonomous Driving (AD) system in an Autonomous Vehicle (AV) needs to perform centimeter-level localization of its own global positions on the map [2]. Such localization function is highly security and safety critical in the AV context, since positioning errors can directly cause an AV to drive off road or onto a wrong way. For outdoor localization, GPS is the de facto location source, and thus a direct threat is GPS spoofing, a long-existing but still unsolved security problem with practicality proven on many end systems. Fortunately, AV systems today predominantly use Multi-Sensor Fusion (MSF) algorithms [3] that are generally believed to have potential to practically defeat GPS spoofing [4]. However, no prior work has studied whether today’s MSF algorithms are indeed sufficiently secure under GPS spoofing, especially in AV settings. In this work, we perform the first study to fill this critical gap. We consider the attack goal as using GPS spoofing to cause large lateral deviations in the MSF output, i.e., deviating to left or right. This can cause the AV to drive off road or onto a wrong way.
papers.abstract_zh: 为了实现高水平的驾驶自动化[1]，自动驾驶车辆(AV)中的自动驾驶(AD)系统需要在地图上执行其自身全球位置的厘米级定位[2]。这种定位功能在AV环境中具有高度的安全性和安全性，因为定位误差会直接导致AV偏离道路或驶上错误的道路。对于室外定位，GPS是事实上的位置源，因此直接威胁是GPS欺骗，这是一个长期存在但仍未解决的安全问题，其实用性已在许多终端系统上得到证明。幸运的是，今天的反病毒系统主要使用多传感器融合(MSF)算法[3]，这种算法通常被认为有可能实际上击败GPS欺骗[4]。然而，没有先前的工作研究今天的MSF算法在GPS欺骗下是否确实足够安全，特别是在AV设置中。在这项工作中，我们进行了第一次研究，以填补这一重要空白。我们认为攻击目标是利用GPS欺骗在MSF输出中造成大的横向偏差，即向左或向右偏离。这会导致AV驶离道路或驶入错误的道路。
papers.title_zh: 演示:高级自动驾驶中基于攻击多传感器融合的定位

papers.title: Demo: Security of Camera-based Perception for Autonomous Driving under Adversarial Attack
papers.authors: Christopher DiPalma, Ningfei Wang, Takami Sato, Qi Alfred Chen
papers.abstract: Robust perception is crucial for autonomous vehicle security. In this work, we design a practical adversarial patch attack against camera-based obstacle detection. We identify that the back of a box truck is an effective attack vector. We also improve attack robustness by considering a variety of input frames associated with the attack scenario. This demo includes videos that show our attack can cause endto-end consequences on a representative autonomous driving system in a simulator.
papers.abstract_zh: 强大的感知对于自动驾驶汽车的安全性至关重要。在这项工作中，我们设计了一个实用的对抗性补丁攻击基于摄像机的障碍检测。我们发现箱式卡车的后部是一个有效的攻击媒介。我们还通过考虑与攻击场景相关的各种输入帧来提高攻击鲁棒性。该演示包括视频，显示我们的攻击可以在模拟器中的代表性自动驾驶系统上造成端到端的后果。
papers.title_zh: 演示:基于摄像头的自动驾驶感知在敌对攻击下的安全性

papers.title: Demo: Security of Deep Learning based Automated Lane Centering under Physical-World Attack
papers.authors: Takami Sato, Junjie Shen, Ningfei Wang, Yunhan Jack Jia, Xue Lin, Qi Alfred Chen
papers.abstract: Automatic Lane Centering (ALC) systems are convenient and widely deployed today, but they are also highly security and safety critical. Recent research shows that Dirty Road Patch (DRP) attack can successfully attack DNN-based ALC systems. In this work, we will demonstrate the DRP attack on a production-level simulator and a physical-world setup.
papers.abstract_zh: 自动车道对中(ALC)系统很方便，目前已被广泛部署，但它们也具有高度的安全性和安全性。最近的研究表明，脏路补丁(DRP)攻击可以成功地攻击基于DNN的ALC系统。在这项工作中，我们将在生产级模拟器和物理环境中演示DRP攻击。
papers.title_zh: 演示:在物理世界攻击下基于深度学习的自动车道居中的安全性

papers.title: Demo: ROI Attacks on Traffic Light Detection in High-Level Autonomous Driving
papers.authors: Kanglan Tang, Junjie Shen, Qi Alfred Chen
papers.abstract: To achieve high-level autonomous driving (AD), the AD system in an Autonomous Vehicle (AV) has two key modules: localization, which estimates the real-time position of the AV on a map, and perception, which incorporates sensors such as cameras, radars, and LiDARs [1] to perceive the surrounding environment of the AV. From high-level design, the localization algorithms and perception algorithms appear to be independent of each other. However, in this work, we discover an interesting design consideration that enables an attacker to blind or misguide the perception without tampering the perception sensor inputs themselves.
papers.abstract_zh: 为了实现高水平的自动驾驶(AD)，自动驾驶车辆(AV)中的AD系统有两个关键模块:定位，估计AV在地图上的实时位置，以及感知，包括相机、雷达和激光雷达等传感器[1]以感知AV的周围环境。从高层设计来看，定位算法和感知算法看起来是相互独立的。然而，在这项工作中，我们发现了一个有趣的设计考虑，使攻击者能够在不篡改感知传感器输入本身的情况下，蒙蔽或误导感知。
papers.title_zh: 演示:高级自动驾驶中交通灯检测的ROI攻击

papers.title: A Containerization-Based Backfit Approach for Industrial Control System Resiliency
papers.authors: James Schaffter, Aviel Rubin, Lanier A. Watkins
papers.abstract: Many industrial control systems (ICS) are reliant upon programmable logic controllers (PLCs) for their operations. As ICS and PLCs are increasingly targeted by cyber-attacks, research facilitating the resiliency of their physical processes is imperative. This paper proposes an approach which leverages PLC containerization, input/output (I/O) multiplexing, and orchestration to respond to cyber incidents and ensure continuity of critical processes. A proofof-concept capability was developed and evaluated on live ICS testbed environments. The experimental results indicate the approach is viable for control applications with soft real-time requirements.
papers.abstract_zh: 许多工业控制系统(ic)依赖可编程逻辑控制器(PLC)进行操作。随着IC和PLC越来越多地成为网络攻击的目标，促进其物理过程弹性的研究势在必行。本文提出了一种利用PLC容器化、输入/输出(I/O)多路复用和编排来响应网络事件并确保关键流程连续性的方法。开发了概念验证能力，并在实时ICS测试平台环境中进行了评估。实验结果表明，该方法对于具有软实时要求的控制应用是可行的。
papers.title_zh: 一种基于容器化的工业控制系统弹性回填方法

papers.title: HIOA-CPS: Combining Hybrid Input-Output Automaton and Game Theory for Security Modeling of Cyber-Physical Systems
papers.authors: Mustafa Abdallah, Sayan Mitra, Shreyas Sundaram, Saurabh Bagchi
papers.abstract: A Cyber-Physical System (CPS) is usually composed of subnetworks where each subnetwork is under ownership of one defender. Security threats on such CPS can be represented by an attack graph where the defenders are required to invest wisely their limited budget in order to protect their critical assets from being compromised. We model such CPS using hybrid input/output automaton (HIOA) where each subnetwork is represented by a HIOA module. We first establish the building blocks needed in our setting. We then present our model that characterizes the continuous time evolution of the investments and discrete transitions between different system’s states (where each state represents a different condition within the system). Finally, we provide a representative real-world CPS to validate our modeling and show its benefit for CPS security.
papers.abstract_zh: 网络物理系统(CPS)通常由子网组成，每个子网归一个防御方所有。这种CPS上的安全威胁可以用攻击图来表示，其中要求防御者明智地投资他们有限的预算，以保护他们的关键资产不受损害。我们使用混合输入/输出自动机(HIOA)对此类CPS建模，其中每个子网由一个HIOA模块表示。我们首先建立我们环境中需要的构件。然后，我们提出了我们的模型，该模型描述了投资的连续时间演化和不同系统状态之间的离散转换(其中每个状态代表系统内的不同条件)。最后，我们提供了一个有代表性的真实CPS来验证我们的模型，并展示它对CPS安全性的好处。
papers.title_zh: HIOA-CPS:结合混合输入输出自动机和博弈论的信息物理系统安全建模

papers.title: Protecting IoT Devices through Localized Detection of BGP Hijacks for Individual Things
papers.authors: DongInn Kim, Vafa Andalibi, Linda Jean Camp
papers.abstract: In this paper, we leverage the limited functionality of IoT devices and the homophily of a single home network to identify control plane attacks. We illustrate the use of privacy-preserving data analysis in machine learning to evaluate the leptokurtic distributions of routes from a single device in an individual home in a specific geographic location. Previously, route hijacking has been approached as a large-scale systems problem, requiring network service providers to take action. Route information from the edge has traditionally been considered inactionable, however, small enterprises and homeowners may be targeted for such attacks for reasons ranging from nations attacking suppliers in critical systems to simple monetization of e-crime. We describe how a single small entity can leverage large-scale historical data with their individual histories to identify these attacks. We implement our proposed method in the form of a local agent that monitors the IoT devices and services for detecting BGP hijacking as well as an agent server that utilizes global history in initializing the local agents.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们利用物联网设备的有限功能和单个家庭网络的同质性来识别控制平面攻击。我们举例说明了在机器学习中使用隐私保护数据分析来评估特定地理位置的个人家庭中的单个设备的路线的细端分布。以前，路由劫持被视为大规模系统问题，需要网络服务提供商采取行动。来自边缘的路由信息传统上被认为是不可移动的，然而，小企业和房主可能成为这种攻击的目标，原因从国家攻击关键系统中的供应商到电子犯罪的简单货币化。我们描述了单个小型实体如何利用大规模历史数据及其各自的历史来识别这些攻击。我们以本地代理和代理服务器的形式实现我们提出的方法，本地代理监控物联网设备和服务以检测BGP劫持，代理服务器利用全局历史来初始化本地代理。
papers.title_zh: 通过局部检测个别物品的BGP劫持来保护物联网设备

papers.title: Egocentric abstractions for modeling and safety verification of distributed cyber-physical systems
papers.authors: Sung Woo Jeon, Sayan Mitra
papers.abstract: Modeling is a significant piece of the puzzle in achieving safety certificates for distributed IoT and cyberphysical systems. From smart home devices to connected and autonomous vehicles, several modeling challenges like dynamic membership of participants and complex interaction patterns, span across application domains. Modeling multiple interacting vehicles can become unwieldy and impractical as vehicles change relative positions and lanes. In this paper, we present an egocentric abstraction for succinctly modeling local interactions among an arbitrary number of agents around an ego agent. These models abstract away the detailed behavior of the other agents and ignore present but physically distant agents. We show that this approach can capture interesting scenarios considered in the responsibility sensitive safety (RSS) framework for autonomous vehicles. As an illustration of how the framework can be useful for analysis, we prove safety of several highway driving scenarios using egocentric models. The proof technique also brings to the forefront the power of a classical verification approach, namely, inductive invariant assertions. We discuss possible generalizations of the analysis to other scenarios and applications.
papers.abstract_zh: 建模是实现分布式物联网和网络物理系统安全证书的一个重要难题。从智能家居设备到互联和自动驾驶汽车，参与者的动态成员关系和复杂的交互模式等建模挑战跨越了多个应用领域。当车辆改变相对位置和车道时，对多个相互作用的车辆进行建模会变得笨拙和不切实际。在本文中，我们提出了一个以自我为中心的抽象，用于简洁地建模一个自我主体周围任意数量的主体之间的本地交互。这些模型抽象出了其他代理的详细行为，并忽略了当前但物理上距离较远的代理。我们表明，这种方法可以捕捉自主车辆责任敏感安全(RSS)框架中考虑的有趣场景。为了说明该框架如何有助于分析，我们使用以自我为中心的模型证明了几个高速公路驾驶场景的安全性。证明技术也将经典验证方法的力量推向了前沿，即归纳不变断言。我们讨论了该分析对其他场景和应用的可能推广。
papers.title_zh: 分布式信息物理系统建模和安全验证的自我中心抽象

papers.title: DeepFake-o-meter: An Open Platform for DeepFake Detection
papers.authors: Yuezun Li, Cong Zhang, Pu Sun, Lipeng Ke, Yan Ju, Honggang Qi, Siwei Lyu
papers.abstract: In recent years, the advent of deep learning-based techniques and the significant reduction in the cost of computation resulted in the feasibility of creating realistic videos of human faces, commonly known as DeepFakes. The availability of open-source tools to create DeepFakes poses as a threat to the trustworthiness of the online media. In this work, we develop an open-source online platform, known as DeepFake-o-meter, that integrates state-of-the-art DeepFake detection methods and provide a convenient interface for the users.
