papers.title: Choose Wisely: A Comparison of Secure Two-Party Computation Frameworks
papers.authors: Jan Henrik Ziegeldorf, Jan Metzke, Martin Henze, Klaus Wehrle
papers.abstract: Secure Two-Party Computation (STC), despite being a powerful tool for privacy engineers, is rarely used practically due to two reasons: i) STCs incur significant overheads and ii) developing efficient STCs requires expert knowledge. Recent works propose a variety of frameworks that address these problems. However, the varying assumptions, scenarios, and benchmarks in these works render results incomparable. It is thus hard, if not impossible, for an inexperienced developer of STCs to choose the best framework for her task. In this paper, we present a thorough quantitative performance analysis of recent STC frameworks. Our results reveal significant performance differences and we identify potential for optimizations as well as new research directions for STC. Complemented by a qualitative discussion of the frameworks' usability, our results provide privacy engineers with a dependable information basis to take the decision for the right STC framework fitting their application.
papers.abstract_zh: 安全的两方计算（STC）尽管是隐私工程师的强大工具，但实际上很少使用，这几乎是由于两个原因：i）STC产生了大量的开销，ii）开发有效的STC需要专业知识。 最近的作品提出了各种解决这些问题的框架。 但是，这些作品中不同的假设，场景和基准使结果无与伦比。 因此，没有经验的STC开发人员很难（即使不是不可能）为她的任务选择最佳框架。 在本文中，我们对最近的STC框架进行了彻底的定量性能分析。 我们的结果揭示了显着的性能差异，我们确定了优化的潜力以及STC的新研究方向。 根据对框架可用性的定性讨论的补充，我们的结果为隐私工程师提供了可靠的信息基础，以根据适合其应用的正确的STC框架做出决定。
papers.title_zh: 明智的选择:安全两方计算框架的比较

papers.title: Tor Experimentation Tools
papers.authors: Fatemeh Shirazi, Matthias Goehring, Claudia Díaz
papers.abstract: Tor is the most popular anonymity network, used by more than 2 million daily users. Engineering privacy enhancing tools such as Tor requires extensive experimentation in order to test attacks, evaluate the effects of changes to the Tor software or analyze statistical data on the Tor network. Since research should not be performed on the live Tor network for multiple reasons, various techniques have been employed for Tor research, including small-scale private Tor networks, simulation and emulation. In this paper, we provide an overview and discussion of existing techniques and tools used for Tor experimentation by categorizing techniques and highlighting advantages and limitations of each tool. The goal of this paper is to provide researchers with the necessary information for selecting the optimal Tor research tool depending on their specific requirements and possibilities.
papers.abstract_zh: TOR是最受欢迎的匿名网络，每天超过200万用户使用。 工程隐私增强工具（例如TOR）需要进行广泛的实验才能测试攻击，评估更改对TOR软件的影响或分析TOR网络上的统计数据。 由于由于多种原因，不应在实时TOR网络上进行研究，因此已经采用了各种技术进行TOR研究，包括小规模的私人TOR网络，仿真和仿真。 在本文中，我们通过对技术进行分类并强调每个工具的优势和局限性，概述和讨论用于TOR实验的现有技术和工具。 本文的目的是为研究人员提供必要的信息，以根据其特定要求和可能性选择最佳的TOR研究工具。
papers.title_zh: Tor实验工具

papers.title: Protecting Private Keys against Memory Disclosure Attacks Using Hardware Transactional Memory
papers.authors: Le Guan, Jingqiang Lin, Bo Luo, Jiwu Jing, Jing Wang
papers.abstract: Cryptography plays an important role in computer and communication security. In practical implementations of cryptosystems, the cryptographic keys are usually loaded into the memory as plaintext, and then used in the cryptographic algorithms. Therefore, the private keys are subject to memory disclosure attacks that read unauthorized data from RAM. Such attacks could be performed through software methods (e.g., Open SSL Heart bleed) even when the integrity of the victim system's executable binaries is maintained. They could also be performed through physical methods (e.g., Cold-boot attacks on RAM chips) even when the system is free of software vulnerabilities. In this paper, we propose Mimosa that protects RSA private keys against the above software-based and physical memory attacks. When the Mimosa service is in idle, private keys are encrypted and reside in memory as cipher text. During the cryptographic computing, Mimosa uses hardware transactional memory (HTM) to ensure that (a) whenever a malicious process other than Mimosa attempts to read the plaintext private key, the transaction aborts and all sensitive data are automatically cleared with hardware mechanisms, due to the strong atomicity guarantee of HTM, and (b) all sensitive data, including private keys and intermediate states, appear as plaintext only within CPU-bound caches, and are never loaded to RAM chips. To the best of our knowledge, Mimosa is the first solution to use transactional memory to protect sensitive data against memory disclosure attacks. We have implemented Mimosa on a commodity machine with Intel Core i7 Haswell CPUs. Through extensive experiments, we show that Mimosa effectively protects cryptographic keys against various attacks that attempt to read sensitive data from memory, and it only introduces a small performance overhead.
papers.abstract_zh: 密码学在计算机和通信安全中起着重要作用。 在加密系统的实际实现中，加密密钥通常以明文为内存，然后在加密算法中使用。 因此，私钥受到内存披露攻击的约束，这些攻击读取了RAM的未经授权数据。 即使保持受害者系统的可执行二进制文件的完整性，也可以通过软件方法（例如，开放式SSL心脏出血）进行此类攻击。 即使系统没有软件漏洞，也可以通过物理方法（例如，对RAM芯片的冷启动攻击）执行它们。 在本文中，我们提出了Mimosa，以保护RSA私钥免受上述基于软件和物理内存攻击的影响。 当Mimosa服务处于空闲状态时，私钥会加密并驻留在内存中作为密码文本。 在加密计算过程中，Mimosa使用硬件交易内存（HTM）来确保（a）每当Mimosa以外的其他恶意过程试图读取明文私钥时，交易中止和所有敏感数据都会因硬件机制自动清除，因此 HTM的强度保证和（b）所有敏感数据，包括私钥和中间状态，仅在CPU结合的缓存中作为纯文本出现，并且永远不会加载到RAM芯片上。 据我们所知，Mimosa是第一个使用交易记忆来保护敏感数据免受内存披露攻击的解决方案。 我们已经在具有Intel Core i7 Haswell CPU的商品机器上实现了Mimosa。 通过广泛的实验，我们表明含羞草有效地保护密码键免受试图从内存读取敏感数据的各种攻击，并且仅引入了一个小的性能开销。
papers.title_zh: 使用硬件事务存储器保护私钥免受存储器泄露攻击

papers.title: CHERI: A Hybrid Capability-System Architecture for Scalable Software Compartmentalization
papers.authors: Robert N. M. Watson, Jonathan Woodruff, Peter G. Neumann, Simon W. Moore, Jonathan Anderson, David Chisnall, Nirav H. Dave, Brooks Davis, Khilan Gudka, Ben Laurie, Steven J. Murdoch, Robert M. Norton, Michael Roe, Stacey D. Son, Munraj Vadera
papers.abstract: CHERI extends a conventional RISC Instruction-Set Architecture, compiler, and operating system to support fine-grained, capability-based memory protection to mitigate memory-related vulnerabilities in C-language TCBs. We describe how CHERI capabilities can also underpin a hardware-software object-capability model for application compartmentalization that can mitigate broader classes of attack. Prototyped as an extension to the open-source 64-bit BERI RISC FPGA soft-core processor, Free BSD operating system, and LLVM compiler, we demonstrate multiple orders-of-magnitude improvement in scalability, simplified programmability, and resulting tangible security benefits as compared to compartmentalization based on pure Memory-Management Unit (MMU) designs. We evaluate incrementally deployable CHERI-based compartmentalization using several real-world UNIX libraries and applications.
papers.abstract_zh: Cheri扩展了传统的RISC指令集架构，编译器和操作系统，以支持基于功能的细粒度，基于功能的内存保护，以减轻C-语言TCB中与内存相关的漏洞。 我们描述了Cheri功能还可以为应用程序区域化的硬件 - 软件对象可靠性模型支撑，该模型可以减轻更广泛的攻击类别。 原型作为开源64位Beri RISC FPGA软核处理器，免费BSD操作系统和LLVM编译器的延伸，我们展示了多种命令的可伸缩性，简化的可编程性，并将其带来的切实安全益处，并将其视为带有切实的安全益处 与基于纯记忆管理单元（MMU）设计的分隔相比。 我们使用多个现实世界的UNIX库和应用程序评估基于Cheri的逐渐部署的分隔。
papers.title_zh: CHERI:一种用于可扩展软件划分的混合能力系统架构

papers.title: VC3: Trustworthy Data Analytics in the Cloud Using SGX
papers.authors: Felix Schuster, Manuel Costa, Cédric Fournet, Christos Gkantsidis, Marcus Peinado, Gloria Mainar-Ruiz, Mark Russinovich
papers.abstract: We present VC3, the first system that allows users to run distributed MapReduce computations in the cloud while keeping their code and data secret, and ensuring the correctness and completeness of their results. VC3 runs on unmodified Hadoop, but crucially keeps Hadoop, the operating system and the hyper visor out of the TCB, thus, confidentiality and integrity are preserved even if these large components are compromised. VC3 relies on SGX processors to isolate memory regions on individual computers, and to deploy new protocols that secure distributed MapReduce computations. VC3 optionally enforces region self-integrity invariants for all MapReduce code running within isolated regions, to prevent attacks due to unsafe memory reads and writes. Experimental results on common benchmarks show that VC3 performs well compared with unprotected Hadoop: VC3's average runtime overhead is negligible for its base security guarantees, 4.5% with write integrity and 8% with read/write integrity.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提供VC3，这是第一个允许用户在云中运行分布式MAPREDUCE计算的系统，同时保留其代码和数据秘密，并确保其结果的正确性和完整性。 VC3在未修改的Hadoop上运行，但至关重要的是将Hadoop，操作系统和超级遮阳板从TCB出发，因此，即使这些大型组件受到损害，也可以保留机密性和完整性。 VC3依靠SGX处理器来隔离单个计算机上的内存区域，并部署保护分布式MAPREDUCE计算的新协议。 VC3可选地为在孤立区域内运行的所有MAPREDUCE代码的区域自我整合不变，以防止由于不安全的内存读取和写入而引起的攻击。 对常见基准测试的实验结果表明，与未受保护的Hadoop相比，VC3的性能很好：VC3的平均运行时间开销的基本安全保证可以忽略不计，具有写入完整性的4.5％，读/写入完整性为8％。
papers.title_zh: VC3:使用SGX在云中进行可信的数据分析

papers.title: Using Hardware Features for Increased Debugging Transparency
papers.authors: Fengwei Zhang, Kevin Leach, Angelos Stavrou, Haining Wang, Kun Sun
papers.abstract: With the rapid proliferation of malware attacks on the Internet, understanding these malicious behaviors plays a critical role in crafting effective defense. Advanced malware analysis relies on virtualization or emulation technology to run samples in a confined environment, and to analyze malicious activities by instrumenting code execution. However, virtual machines and emulators inevitably create artifacts in the execution environment, making these approaches vulnerable to detection or subversion. In this paper, we present MALT, a debugging framework that employs System Management Mode, a CPU mode in the x86 architecture, to transparently study armored malware. MALT does not depend on virtualization or emulation and thus is immune to threats targeting such environments. Our approach reduces the attack surface at the software level, and advances state-of-the-art debugging transparency. MALT embodies various debugging functions, including register/memory accesses, breakpoints, and four stepping modes. We implemented a prototype of MALT on two physical machines, and we conducted experiments by testing an array of existing anti-virtualization, anti-emulation, and packing techniques against MALT. The experimental results show that our prototype remains transparent and undetected against the samples. Furthermore, our prototype of MALT introduces moderate but manageable overheads on both Windows and Linux platforms.
papers.abstract_zh: 随着恶意软件攻击在互联网上的快速扩散，了解这些恶意行为在制定有效的防御方面起着至关重要的作用。 高级恶意软件分析依靠虚拟化或仿真技术在受限环境中运行样本，并通过仪器执行仪器来分析恶意活动。 但是，虚拟机和模拟器不可避免地会在执行环境中创建工件，从而使这些方法容易受到检测或颠覆。 在本文中，我们提出了麦芽（Malt），这是一种使用系统管理模式（X86体系结构中的CPU模式）的调试框架，以透明地研究装甲恶意软件。 麦芽不取决于虚拟化或仿真，因此不受针对此类环境的威胁。 我们的方法在软件级别降低了攻击表面，并提高了最先进的调试透明度。 麦芽体现了各种调试功能，包括寄存器/内存访问，断点和四个步进模式。 我们在两台物理机器上实施了麦芽的原型，并通过测试针对麦芽的一系列现有抗虚拟化，抗魔力和包装技术进行了实验。 实验结果表明，我们的原型保持透明，并未针对样品进行检测。 此外，我们的麦芽原型在Windows和Linux平台上都引入了中等但易于管理的开销。
papers.title_zh: 使用硬件特性增加调试透明度

papers.title: Virtual Proofs of Reality and their Physical Implementation
papers.authors: Ulrich Rührmair, J. L. Martinez-Hurtado, Xiaolin Xu, Christian Kraeh, Christian Hilgers, Dima Kononchuk, Jonathan J. Finley, Wayne P. Burleson
papers.abstract: We discuss the question of how physical statements can be proven over digital communication channels between two parties (a "prover" and a "verifier") residing in two separate local systems. Examples include: (i) "a certain object in the prover's system has temperature X°C", (ii) "two certain objects in the prover's system are positioned at distance X", or (iii) "a certain object in the prover's system has been irreversibly altered or destroyed". As illustrated by these examples, our treatment goes beyond classical security sensors in considering more general physical statements. Another distinctive aspect is the underlying security model: We neither assume secret keys in the prover's system, nor do we suppose classical sensor hardware in his system which is tamper-resistant and trusted by the verifier. Without an established name, we call this new type of security protocol a "virtual proof of reality" or simply a "virtual proof" (VP). In order to illustrate our novel concept, we give example VPs based on temperature sensitive integrated circuits, disordered optical scattering media, and quantum systems. The corresponding protocols prove the temperature, relative position, or destruction/modification of certain physical objects in the prover's system to the verifier. These objects (so-called "witness objects") are prepared by the verifier and handed over to the prover prior to the VP. Furthermore, we verify the practical validity of our method for all our optical and circuit-based VPs in detailed proof-of-concept experiments. Our work touches upon, and partly extends, several established concepts in cryptography and security, including physical unclonable functions, quantum cryptography, interactive proof systems, and, most recently, physical zero-knowledge proofs. We also discuss potential advancements of our method, for example "public virtual proofs" that function without exchanging witness objects between the verifier and the prover.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们讨论了如何通过在两个单独的本地系统中的两个当事方（a prover”和一个“ verifier”）之间的数字通信渠道来证明物理陈述的问题。 示例包括：（i）“供者系统中的某个对象具有温度x°C”，（ii）“供者系统中的两个某些对象定位在距离x”，或（iii）“供供体的某个对象” 系统已被不可逆转地改变或破坏。 如这些示例所示，我们的治疗方法超出了经典的安全传感器，考虑了更一般的物理陈述。 另一个独特的方面是潜在的安全模型：我们既不在供者的系统中假设秘密密钥，也不假设他的系统中经典的传感器硬件是对验证者的耐受性和信任的。 如果没有建立的名称，我们将这种新型的安全协议称为“现实的虚拟证明”或仅仅是“虚拟证明”（VP）。 为了说明我们的新概念，我们为基于温度敏感的集成电路，光学散射介质和量子系统提供了示例VPS。 相应的协议证明了对验证者的某些物理对象的温度，相对位置或破坏/修改。 这些对象（所谓的“证人对象”）由验证者制备，并在副总裁之前移交给供供者。 此外，我们在详细的概念验证实验中验证了所有基于光学和电路的VP的方法的实际有效性。 我们的工作涉及加密和安全方面的几个既定概念，包括物理不封次功能，量子密码学，交互式证明系统以及最近的物理零知识证明。 我们还讨论了我们方法的潜在进步，例如该功能的“公共虚拟证明”，而无需在验证者和供奉献者之间交换证人对象。
papers.title_zh: 现实的虚拟证明及其物理实现

papers.title: The Miner's Dilemma
papers.authors: Ittay Eyal
papers.abstract: An open distributed system can be secured by requiring participants to present proof of work and rewarding them for participation. The Bit coin digital currency introduced this mechanism, which is adopted by almost all contemporary digital currencies and related services. A natural process leads participants of such systems to form pools, where members aggregate their power and share the rewards. Experience with Bit coin shows that the largest pools are often open, allowing anyone to join. It has long been known that a member can sabotage an open pool by seemingly joining it but never sharing its proofs of work. The pool shares its revenue with the attacker, and so each of its participants earns less. We define and analyze a game where pools use some of their participants to infiltrate other pools and perform such an attack. With any number of pools, no-pool-attacks is not a Nash equilibrium. We study the special cases where either two pools or any number of identical pools play the game and the rest of the participants are uninvolved. In both of these cases there exists an equilibrium that constitutes a tragedy of the commons where the participating pools attack one another and earn less than they would have if none had attacked. For two pools, the decision whether or not to attack is the miner's dilemma, an instance of the iterative prisoner's dilemma. The game is played daily by the active Bit coin pools, which apparently choose not to attack. If this balance breaks, the revenue of open pools might diminish, making them unattractive to participants.
papers.abstract_zh: 可以通过要求参与者提供工作证明并奖励他们参与的开放分布式系统。 位硬币数字货币引入了这种机制，几乎所有当代数字货币和相关服务都采用了这种机制。 一个自然的过程导致此类系统的参与者组成池，成员汇总了他们的权力并分享奖励。 有位硬币的经验表明，最大的游泳池通常是开放的，可以让任何人加入。 早就知道，成员似乎可以加入开放池，但从未分享其工作证明。 游泳池与攻击者分享其收入，因此每个参与者的收入降低。 我们定义和分析了一个游戏，其中池使用一些参与者渗透其他池并进行此类攻击。 对于任何数量的池，无池攻击不是NASH平衡。 我们研究了两个游泳池或任何数量相同的池玩游戏的特殊情况，其余参与者都没有参与。 在这两种情况下，存在一个平衡，构成了公共场所的悲剧，在那里，参与池相互攻击，赚取的收入低于没有攻击的情况。 对于两个池，决定是否攻击是矿工的困境，这是迭代囚犯困境的一个例子。 该游戏每天都由主动的位硬币池进行，显然选择不攻击。 如果这种余额破裂，则开放池的收入可能会减少，从而使他们对参与者没有吸引力。
papers.title_zh: 矿工的困境

papers.title: SoK: Research Perspectives and Challenges for Bitcoin and Cryptocurrencies
papers.authors: Joseph Bonneau, Andrew Miller, Jeremy Clark, Arvind Narayanan, Joshua A. Kroll, Edward W. Felten
papers.abstract: Bit coin has emerged as the most successful cryptographic currency in history. Within two years of its quiet launch in 2009, Bit coin grew to comprise billions of dollars of economic value despite only cursory analysis of the system's design. Since then a growing literature has identified hidden-but-important properties of the system, discovered attacks, proposed promising alternatives, and singled out difficult future challenges. Meanwhile a large and vibrant open-source community has proposed and deployed numerous modifications and extensions. We provide the first systematic exposition Bit coin and the many related crypto currencies or 'altcoins.' Drawing from a scattered body of knowledge, we identify three key components of Bit coin's design that can be decoupled. This enables a more insightful analysis of Bit coin's properties and future stability. We map the design space for numerous proposed modifications, providing comparative analyses for alternative consensus mechanisms, currency allocation mechanisms, computational puzzles, and key management tools. We survey anonymity issues in Bit coin and provide an evaluation framework for analyzing a variety of privacy-enhancing proposals. Finally we provide new insights on what we term disinter mediation protocols, which absolve the need for trusted intermediaries in an interesting set of applications. We identify three general disinter mediation strategies and provide a detailed comparison.
papers.abstract_zh: Bit Coin已成为历史上最成功的加密货币。 在2009年安静推出后的两年内，尽管仅粗略地分析了该系统的设计，但Bit Coin仍在增长以构成数十亿美元的经济价值。 从那时起，越来越多的文献已经确定了该系统的隐藏但最重要的特性，发现了攻击，提出了有希望的替代方案，并挑出了艰难的未来挑战。 同时，一个充满活力的开源社区提出并部署了许多修改和扩展。 我们提供了第一个系统的博览会位硬币以及许多相关的加密货币或“ altcoins”。 我们从散落的知识中汲取灵感，我们确定了可以解耦的位硬币设计的三个关键组成部分。 这使得对位硬币的性质和未来稳定性进行了更深入的分析。 我们为众多建议的修改绘制了设计空间，为替代共识机制，货币分配机制，计算难题和关键管理工具提供了比较分析。 我们调查了位硬币中的匿名性问题，并提供了一个评估框架，用于分析各种隐私提高建议。 最后，我们提供了有关我们术语DISINTER中介协议的新见解，这些协议可以在一组有趣的应用程序中无需受信任的中介机构。 我们确定了三种通用分解调解策略，并提供了详细的比较。
papers.title_zh: SoK:比特币和加密货币的研究前景和挑战

papers.title: Bitcoin over Tor isn't a Good Idea
papers.authors: Alex Biryukov, Ivan Pustogarov
papers.abstract: Bit coin is a decentralized P2P digital currency in which coins are generated by a distributed set of miners and transactions are broadcasted via a peer-to-peer network. While Bit coin provides some level of anonymity (or rather pseudonymity) by encouraging the users to have any number of random-looking Bit coin addresses, recent research shows that this level of anonymity is rather low. This encourages users to connect to the Bit coin network through anonymizers like Tor and motivates development of default Tor functionality for popular mobile SPV clients. In this paper we show that combining Tor and Bit coin creates a new attack vector. A low-resource attacker can gain full control of information flows between all users who chose to use Bit coin over Tor. In particular the attacker can link together user's transactions regardless of pseudonyms used, control which Bit coin blocks and transactions are relayed to user and can delay or discard user's transactions and blocks. Moreover, we show how an attacker can fingerprint users and then recognize them and learn their IP addresses when they decide to connect to the Bit coin network directly.
papers.abstract_zh: BIT硬币是一种分散的P2P数字货币，在该货币中，由分布式矿工组生成硬币，交易是通过对等网络广播的。 尽管BIT Coin通过鼓励用户具有许多随机的位硬币地址来提供一定程度的匿名性（或更确切地说是假名），但最近的研究表明，这种匿名水平相当低。 这鼓励用户通过TOR等匿名者连接到位硬币网络，并激励流行的移动SPV客户端的默认TOR功能开发。 在本文中，我们表明将TOR和BIT硬币组合起来会创建一个新的攻击向量。 低资源攻击者可以完全控制所有选择在TOR上使用位硬币的用户之间的信息流。 特别是，攻击者可以将用户的交易链接在一起，而不管使用的假名如何，控制哪些位硬币块和交易将中继到用户，并且可以延迟或丢弃用户的交易和块。 此外，我们展示了攻击者如何指示用户，然后在决定直接连接到位硬币网络时识别并学习其IP地址。
papers.title_zh: 比特币取代Tor不是一个好主意

papers.title: Every Second Counts: Quantifying the Negative Externalities of Cybercrime via Typosquatting
papers.authors: Mohammad Taha Khan, Xiang Huo, Zhou Li, Chris Kanich
papers.abstract: While we have a good understanding of how cyber crime is perpetrated and the profits of the attackers, the harm experienced by humans is less well understood, and reducing this harm should be the ultimate goal of any security intervention. This paper presents a strategy for quantifying the harm caused by the cyber crime of typo squatting via the novel technique of intent inference. Intent inference allows us to define a new metric for quantifying harm to users, develop a new methodology for identifying typo squatting domain names, and quantify the harm caused by various typo squatting perpetrators. We find that typo squatting costs the typical user 1.3 seconds per typo squatting event over the alternative of receiving a browser error page, and legitimate sites lose approximately 5% of their mistyped traffic over the alternative of an unregistered typo. Although on average perpetrators increase the time it takes a user to find their intended site, many typo squatters actually improve the latency between a typo and its correction, calling into question the necessity of harsh penalties or legal intervention against this flavor of cyber crime.
papers.abstract_zh: 尽管我们对网络犯罪的犯罪方式有很好的了解以及攻击者的利润，但人类所造成的伤害知之甚少，减少这种危害应该是任何安全干预的最终目标。 本文提出了一种通过新颖的意图推理技术蹲下的网络犯罪造成的危害的策略。 意图推断使我们能够定义一个新的度量标准，以量化对用户的损害，开发一种新方法来识别识别错别字蹲域名称，并量化由各种错别字蹲犯造成犯罪者造成的损害。 我们发现，在接收浏览器错误页面的替代方案上，典型用户的打字蹲在每个错别字中蹲的事件的费用为1.3秒，而合法的站点在未注册的错别字的替代方案上损失了大约5％的误入流量。 尽管平均而言，肇事者会增加用户找到预期网站所花费的时间，但许多错别字擅自占地者实际上改善了错字与其更正之间的延迟，质疑对这种网络犯罪风格的严厉惩罚或法律干预的必要性。
papers.title_zh: 分秒必争:通过域名抢注量化网络犯罪的负面外部性

papers.title: Ad Injection at Scale: Assessing Deceptive Advertisement Modifications
papers.authors: Kurt Thomas, Elie Bursztein, Chris Grier, Grant Ho, Nav Jagpal, Alexandros Kapravelos, Damon McCoy, Antonio Nappa, Vern Paxson, Paul Pearce, Niels Provos, Moheeb Abu Rajab
papers.abstract: Today, web injection manifests in many forms, but fundamentally occurs when malicious and unwanted actors tamper directly with browser sessions for their own profit. In this work we illuminate the scope and negative impact of one of these forms, ad injection, in which users have ads imposed on them in addition to, or different from, those that websites originally sent them. We develop a multi-staged pipeline that identifies ad injection in the wild and captures its distribution and revenue chains. We find that ad injection has entrenched itself as a cross-browser monetization platform impacting more than 5% of unique daily IP addresses accessing Google -- tens of millions of users around the globe. Injected ads arrive on a client's machine through multiple vectors: our measurements identify 50,870 Chrome extensions and 34,407 Windows binaries, 38% and 17% of which are explicitly malicious. A small number of software developers support the vast majority of these injectors who in turn syndicate from the larger ad ecosystem. We have contacted the Chrome Web Store and the advertisers targeted by ad injectors to alert each of the deceptive practices involved.
papers.abstract_zh: 如今，网络注射以多种形式表现出来，但是从根本上讲，发生恶意和不必要的演员直接篡改浏览器会议以供自己利润。 在这项工作中，我们阐明了这些形式之一，广告注入的范围和负面影响，其中用户对它们除了网站最初发送的广告外，对它们强加了广告。 我们开发了一条多阶段的管道，该管道可以识别野外广告注入并捕获其分布和收入链。 我们发现，广告注入已成为一个跨浏览器货币化平台，影响了访问Google的唯一每日IP地址的5％以上 - 全球数千万用户。 注入的广告通过多个向量到达客户端的机器：我们的测量值确定了50,870个镀铬扩展名和34,407个Windows二进制文件，其中38％和17％明显是恶意的。 少数软件开发人员支持大多数这些喷油器，而这些喷油器反过来又来自较大的AD生态系统。 我们已经联系了Chrome网络商店和广告注射器针对的广告商，以提醒每个涉及的欺骗性实践。
papers.title_zh: 大规模广告注入:评估欺骗性广告修改

papers.title: Connection-Oriented DNS to Improve Privacy and Security
papers.authors: Liang Zhu, Zi Hu, John S. Heidemann, Duane Wessels, Allison Mankin, Nikita Somaiya
papers.abstract: The Domain Name System (DNS) seems ideal for connectionless UDP, yet this choice results in challenges of eavesdropping that compromises privacy, source-address spoofing that simplifies denial-of-service (DoS) attacks on the server and third parties, injection attacks that exploit fragmentation, and reply-size limits that constrain key sizes and policy choices. We propose T-DNS to address these problems. It uses TCP to smoothly support large payloads and to mitigate spoofing and amplification for DoS. T-DNS uses transport-layer security (TLS) to provide privacy from users to their DNS resolvers and optionally to authoritative servers. TCP and TLS are hardly novel, and expectations about DNS suggest connections will balloon client latency and overwhelm server with state. Our contribution is to show that T-DNS significantly improves security and privacy: TCP prevents denial-of-service (DoS) amplification against others, reduces the effects of DoS on the server, and simplifies policy choices about key size. TLS protects against eavesdroppers to the recursive resolver. Our second contribution is to show that with careful implementation choices, these benefits come at only modest cost: end-to-end latency from TLS to the recursive resolver is only about 9% slower when UDP is used to the authoritative server, and 22% slower with TCP to the authoritative. With diverse traces we show that connection reuse can be frequent (60 -- 95% for stub and recursive resolvers, although half that for authoritative servers), and after connection establishment, experiments show that TCP and TLS latency is equivalent to UDP. With conservative timeouts (20 s at authoritative servers and 60 s elsewhere) and estimated per-connection memory, we show that server memory requirements match current hardware: a large recursive resolver may have 24k active connections requiring about 3.6 GB additional RAM. Good performance requires key design and implementation decisions we identify: query pipelining, out-of-order responses, TCP fast-open and TLS connection resumption, and plausible timeouts.
papers.abstract_zh: 域名系统（DNS）似乎是无连接UDP的理想选择，但是这种选择会带来窃听的挑战，这些挑战损害了隐私，来源地址欺骗，简化了对服务器和第三方的拒绝服务（DOS）攻击，注射攻击，这些攻击 利用碎片和回复大小的限制，以限制密钥大小和策略选择。 我们建议T-DNS解决这些问题。 它使用TCP平稳支持大的有效载荷，并减轻DOS的欺骗和放大。 T-DNS使用运输层安全性（TLS）向用户提供其DNS解析器以及权威服务器的隐私。 TCP和TLS几乎没有新颖，对DNS的期望表明，连接将激增客户端延迟和与州的压倒服务器。 我们的贡献是表明T-DN会大大提高安全性和隐私：TCP防止拒绝服务（DOS）对他人的放大，减少DOS对服务器的影响，并简化有关关键大小的策略选择。 TLS可预防递归解析器的窃听器。 我们的第二个贡献是表明，通过仔细的实施选择，这些好处仅以适度的成本出现：从TLS到递归解析器的端到端延迟仅在UDP使用给权威服务器时慢9％，而22％ 使用TCP较慢。 有了不同的轨迹，我们表明连接重复使用可能是频繁的（对存根和递归解析器的60-95％，尽管对权威服务器的一半），并且在建立连接后，实验表明TCP和TLS潜伏期等于UDP。 借助保守的超时（在权威服务器处20 s，在其他地方60 s）和估计的每连接内存，我们表明服务器内存需求与当前硬件相匹配：大型递归解析器可能具有24k的活动连接，需要约3.6 GB的其他RAM。 良好的性能需要我们确定的关键设计和实施决策：查询管道端口，端外响应，TCP快速开放和TLS连接恢复以及合理的超时。
papers.title_zh: 面向连接的DNS提高隐私和安全性

papers.title: Temporal Lensing and Its Application in Pulsing Denial-of-Service Attacks
papers.authors: Ryan Rasti, Mukul Murthy, Nicholas Weaver, Vern Paxson
papers.abstract: We introduce "temporal lensing": a technique that concentrates a relatively low-bandwidth flood into a short, high-bandwidth pulse. By leveraging existing DNS infrastructure, we experimentally explore lensing and the properties of the pulses it creates. We also empirically show how attackers can use lensing alone to achieve peak bandwidths more than an order of magnitude greater than their upload bandwidth. While formidable by itself in a pulsing DoS attack, attackers can also combine lensing with amplification to potentially produce pulses with peak bandwidths orders of magnitude larger than their own.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们引入了“颞透明”：一种将相对较低的洪水集中在短，高带宽脉冲中的技术。 通过利用现有的DNS基础架构，我们通过实验探索镜头及其创建的脉冲的特性。 我们还从经验上展示了攻击者如何单独使用镜头来实现峰值带宽的数量级比上载带宽大的数量级。 攻击者在脉冲DOS攻击中本身可以强大，但也可以将镜头与放大结合起来，以产生比其自身大的数量级的峰值带宽顺序的脉冲。
papers.title_zh: 时间透镜及其在脉冲拒绝服务攻击中的应用

papers.title: Secure Track Verification
papers.authors: Matthias Schäfer, Vincent Lenders, Jens B. Schmitt
papers.abstract: We propose a new approach for securely verifying sequences of location claims from mobile nodes. The key idea is to exploit the inherent mobility of the nodes in order to constrain the degree of freedom of an attacker when spoofing consecutive location updates along a claimed track. We show that in the absence of noise, our approach is able to securely verify any 2-D track with a minimum of three verifiers or any 3-D track with four verifiers. Our approach is lightweight in the sense that it considerably relaxes the system requirements compared to previous secure location verification schemes which are all agnostic to mobility. As opposed to previous schemes, our track verification solution is at the same time (i) passive, (ii) does not require any time synchronization among the verifiers, (iii) does not need to keep the location of the verifiers secret, (iv) nor does it require specialized hardware. This makes our solution particularly suitable for large-scale deployments. We have evaluated our solution in a realistic air traffic monitoring scenario using real-world data. Our results show that 25 position claims on a track are sufficient to detect spoofing attacks with a false positive rate of 1.4% and a false negative rate of 1.2%. For tracks with more than 40 claims, the false positive and false negative rates drop to zero.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提出了一种新方法，以安全地验证移动节点的位置索赔序列。 关键思想是利用节点的固有移动性，以限制攻击者沿声称的轨道进行连续的位置更新时的攻击者自由度。 我们表明，在没有噪音的情况下，我们的方法能够使用至少三个验证者或带有四个验证器的任何3-D轨道安全地验证任何2D轨道。 与以前的安全位置验证方案相比，我们的方法是轻巧的，因为它可以大大放松系统要求，而这些验证方案都是不可知的。 与以前的方案相反，我们的轨道验证解决方案同时是（i）被动，（ii）不需要在验证者之间进行任何时间同步，（iii）不需要保持验证者的位置秘密（iv） ）也不需要专门的硬件。 这使我们的解决方案特别适合大规模部署。 我们已经使用现实世界数据在现实的空中交通监视方案中评估了解决方案。 我们的结果表明，轨道上的25个职位索赔足以检测伪正率为1.4％的伪造攻击，假阴性率为1.2％。 对于有40多个索赔的轨道，假阳性和假负率降至零。
papers.title_zh: 安全跟踪验证

papers.title: How Secure and Quick is QUIC? Provable Security and Performance Analyses
papers.authors: Robert Lychev, Samuel Jero, Alexandra Boldyreva, Cristina Nita-Rotaru
papers.abstract: QUIC is a secure transport protocol developed by Google and implemented in Chrome in 2013, currently representing one of the most promising solutions to decreasing latency while intending to provide security properties similar with TLS. In this work we shed some light on QUIC's strengths and weaknesses in terms of its provable security and performance guarantees in the presence of attackers. We first introduce a security model for analyzing performance-driven protocols like QUIC and prove that QUIC satisfies our definition under reasonable assumptions on the protocol's building blocks. However, we find that QUIC does not satisfy the traditional notion of forward secrecy that is provided by some modes of TLS, e.g., TLS-DHE. Our analyses also reveal that with simple bit-flipping and replay attacks on some public parameters exchanged during the handshake, an adversary could easily prevent QUIC from achieving minimal latency advantages either by having it fall back to TCP or by causing the client and server to have an inconsistent view of their handshake leading to a failure to complete the connection. We have implemented these attacks and demonstrated that they are practical. Our results suggest that QUIC's security weaknesses are introduced by the very mechanisms used to reduce latency, which highlights the seemingly inherent trade off between minimizing latency and providing "good" security guarantees.
papers.abstract_zh: QUIC是由Google开发的安全运输协议，并于2013年在Chrome实施，目前代表了降低延迟的最有前途的解决方案之一，同时打算提供与TLS相似的安全属性。 在这项工作中，我们阐明了Quic在攻击者面前可证明的安全性和绩效保证方面的优势和劣势。 我们首先引入了一个安全模型，用于分析诸如QUIC之类的绩效驱动的协议，并证明Quic在协议构件的合理假设下满足了我们的定义。 但是，我们发现Quic无法满足某些TLS（例如TLS-DHE）提供的传统远期保密概念。 我们的分析还表明，通过对握手期间交换的某些公共参数进行简单的位置和重播攻击，对手可以轻松地防止Quic通过使其落回TCP或通过导致客户端和服务器具有最小的延迟优势。 对他们的握手的看法不一致，导致无法完成连接。 我们已经实施了这些攻击，并证明它们是实用的。 我们的结果表明，Quic的安全弱点是通过用于减少潜伏期的机制引入的，这突出了最小化潜伏期和提供“良好”安全保证的看似固有的权衡。
papers.title_zh: QUIC有多安全快捷？可证明的安全性和性能分析

papers.title: SoK: Secure Messaging
papers.authors: Nik Unger, Sergej Dechand, Joseph Bonneau, Sascha Fahl, Henning Perl, Ian Goldberg, Matthew Smith
papers.abstract: Motivated by recent revelations of widespread state surveillance of personal communication, many solutions now claim to offer secure and private messaging. This includes both a large number of new projects and many widely adopted tools that have added security features. The intense pressure in the past two years to deliver solutions quickly has resulted in varying threat models, incomplete objectives, dubious security claims, and a lack of broad perspective on the existing cryptographic literature on secure communication. In this paper, we evaluate and systematize current secure messaging solutions and propose an evaluation framework for their security, usability, and ease-of-adoption properties. We consider solutions from academia, but also identify innovative and promising approaches used "in-the-wild" that are not considered by the academic literature. We identify three key challenges and map the design landscape for each: trust establishment, conversation security, and transport privacy. Trust establishment approaches offering strong security and privacy features perform poorly from a usability and adoption perspective, whereas some hybrid approaches that have not been well studied in the academic literature might provide better trade-offs in practice. In contrast, once trust is established, conversation security can be achieved without any user involvement in most two-party conversations, though conversations between larger groups still lack a good solution. Finally, transport privacy appears to be the most difficult problem to solve without paying significant performance penalties.
papers.abstract_zh: 由于最近对个人交流的广泛调查的启示，许多解决方案现在声称提供安全和私人的消息传递。 这既包括许多新项目，也包括许多添加了安全功能的广泛采用工具。 在过去两年中，迅速提供解决方案的巨大压力导致了威胁模型，不完整的目标，可疑的安全要求以及对现有的有关安全通信的加密文献缺乏广泛的看法。 在本文中，我们评估并系统化当前的安全消息传递解决方案，并为其安全性，可用性和易于易于的评估框架提出评估框架。 我们考虑了学术界的解决方案，但也确定了使用学术文献未考虑的“野外”所使用的创新和有前途的方法。 我们确定了三个主要挑战，并为每种挑战绘制设计格局：信任建立，对话安全和运输隐私。 从可用性和采用的角度来看，提供强大安全性和隐私功能的信任建立方法表现不佳，而在学术文献中尚未对一些混合方法进行的一些混合方法可能会在实践中提供更好的权衡。 相比之下，一旦建立了信任，可以在大多数两党对话中任何用户参与的情况下实现对话安全性，尽管较大组之间的对话仍然缺乏良好的解决方案。 最后，运输隐私似乎是不支付重大绩效罚款而解决的最困难的问题。
papers.title_zh: SoK:安全消息

papers.title: Geppetto: Versatile Verifiable Computation
papers.authors: Craig Costello, Cédric Fournet, Jon Howell, Markulf Kohlweiss, Benjamin Kreuter, Michael Naehrig, Bryan Parno, Samee Zahur
papers.abstract: Cloud computing sparked interest in Verifiable Computation protocols, which allow a weak client to securely outsource computations to remote parties. Recent work has dramatically reduced the client's cost to verify the correctness of their results, but the overhead to produce proofs remains largely impractical. Geppetto introduces complementary techniques for reducing prover overhead and increasing prover flexibility. With Multi QAPs, Geppetto reduces the cost of sharing state between computations (e.g, For MapReduce) or within a single computation by up to two orders of magnitude. Via a careful choice of cryptographic primitives, Geppetto's instantiation of bounded proof bootstrapping improves on prior bootstrapped systems by up to five orders of magnitude, albeit at some cost in universality. Geppetto also efficiently verifies the correct execution of proprietary (i.e, Secret) algorithms. Finally, Geppetto's use of energy-saving circuits brings the prover's costs more in line with the program's actual (rather than worst-case) execution time. Geppetto is implemented in a full-fledged, scalable compiler and runtime that consume LLVM code generated from a variety of source C programs and cryptographic libraries.
papers.abstract_zh: 云计算引发了对可验证的计算协议的兴趣，该协议使弱客户可以将计算安全地外包给远程各方。 最近的工作大大降低了客户的成本以验证其结果的正确性，但是产生证明的开销基本上仍然是不切实际的。 Geppetto引入了互补的技术，以减少供供费用并提高谚语灵活性。 使用Multi QAPS，Geppetto降低了在计算之间（例如，对于MapReduce）或在单个计算中的共享状态成本，最多可达两个数量级。 通过仔细的加密原始图，Geppetto对有限的证明自举的实例化可改善先前的自举系统，最多可提高五个数量级，尽管以普遍性为代价。 Geppetto还有效地验证了专有（即秘密）算法的正确执行。 最后，盖佩托（Geppetto）对节能电路的使用使供奉献的成本更符合该计划的实际（而不是最坏的）执行时间。 Geppetto以成熟的，可扩展的编译器和运行时实现，该运行时间消耗了从各种源C程序和加密库中生成的LLVM代码。
papers.title_zh: Geppetto:通用的可验证计算

papers.title: ADSNARK: Nearly Practical and Privacy-Preserving Proofs on Authenticated Data
papers.authors: Michael Backes, Manuel Barbosa, Dario Fiore, Raphael M. Reischuk
papers.abstract: We study the problem of privacy-preserving proofs on authenticated data, where a party receives data from a trusted source and is requested to prove computations over the data to third parties in a correct and private way, i.e., The third party learns no information on the data but is still assured that the claimed proof is valid. Our work particularly focuses on the challenging requirement that the third party should be able to verify the validity with respect to the specific data authenticated by the source -- even without having access to that source. This problem is motivated by various scenarios emerging from several application areas such as wearable computing, smart metering, or general business-to-business interactions. Furthermore, these applications also demand any meaningful solution to satisfy additional properties related to usability and scalability. In this paper, we formalize the above three-party model, discuss concrete application scenarios, and then we design, build, and evaluate ADSNARK, a nearly practical system for proving arbitrary computations over authenticated data in a privacy-preserving manner. ADSNARK improves significantly over state-of-the-art solutions for this model. For instance, compared to corresponding solutions based on Pinocchio (Oakland'13), ADSNARK achieves up to 25x improvement in proof-computation time and a 20x reduction in prover storage space.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们研究身份验证数据的保密性证明的问题，该方面的一方从受信任的来源接收数据，并要求以正确和私人的方式向第三方证明对数据的计算，即第三方没有学习有关的信息。 数据，但仍保证声称的证明是有效的。 我们的工作尤其关注具有挑战性的要求，即第三方应该能够验证来源认证的特定数据的有效性 - 即使没有访问该来源。 这个问题是由多个应用领域（例如可穿戴计算，智能计量或一般企业对企业之间的互动）出现的各种情况所激发的。 此外，这些应用还需要任何有意义的解决方案，以满足与可用性和可扩展性相关的其他属性。 在本文中，我们对上述三方模型进行了形式化，讨论具体的应用程序方案，然后我们设计，构建和评估Adsnark，这是一个几乎实用的系统，用于以隐私保护方式证明对认证数据的任意计算。 Adsnark在该模型的最新解决方案上大大改善了。 例如，与基于Pinocchio（Oakland'13）的相应解决方案相比，Adsnark的证明时间量提高了25倍，供供者存储空间降低了20倍。
papers.title_zh: ADSNARK:对认证数据的近乎实用的隐私保护证明

papers.title: Secure Sampling of Public Parameters for Succinct Zero Knowledge Proofs
papers.authors: Eli Ben-Sasson, Alessandro Chiesa, Matthew Green, Eran Tromer, Madars Virza
papers.abstract: Non-interactive zero-knowledge proofs (NIZKs) are a powerful cryptographic tool, with numerous potential applications. However, succinct NIZKs (e.g., zk-SNARK schemes) necessitate a trusted party to generate and publish some public parameters, to be used by all provers and verifiers. This party is trusted to correctly run a probabilistic algorithm (specified by the the proof system) that outputs the public parameters, and publish them, without leaking any other information (such as the internal randomness used by the algorithm), violating either requirement may allow malicious parties to produce convincing "proofs" of false statements. This trust requirement poses a serious impediment to deploying NIZKs in many applications, because a party that is trusted by all users of the envisioned system may simply not exist. In this work, we show how public parameters for a class of NIZKs can be generated by a multi-party protocol, such that if at least one of the parties is honest, then the result is secure (in both aforementioned senses) and can be subsequently used for generating and verifying numerous proofs without any further trust. We design and implement such a protocol, tailored to efficiently support the state-of-the-art NIZK constructions with short and easy-to-verify proofs (Parno et al. IEEE S&P '13, Ben-Sasson et al. USENIX Sec '14, Danezis et al., ASIACRYPT '14). Applications of our system include generating public parameters for systems such as Zero cash (Ben-Sasson et al. IEEE S&P '13) and the scalable zero-knowledge proof system of (Ben-Sasson et al. CRYPTO '14).
papers.abstract_zh: 非相互作用的零知识证明（NIZK）是一种强大的加密工具，具有许多潜在的应用。 但是，简洁的Nizks（例如，ZK-SNARK计划）需要一个值得信赖的一方生成和发布一些公共参数，以供所有抛弃者和验证者使用。 信任该方可以正确运行输出公共参数的概率算法（由证明系统指定），并发布它们，而不会泄漏任何其他信息（例如算法使用的内部随机性），违反了任何要求都可以允许 恶意政党产生令人信服的虚假陈述的“证明”。 该信任要求对在许多应用程序中部署Nizks构成了严重的障碍，因为一个被设想系统的所有用户信任的一方可能根本不存在。 在这项工作中，我们展示了如何通过多方协议来生成一类Nizks的公共参数，以便如果至少一个当事方是诚实的，那么结果是安全的（从上述意义上讲），并且可以是 随后用于生成和验证众多证据，而无需任何进一步的信任。 我们设计和实施了这样的协议，该协议是为了有效地支持具有简短且易于验证的证据的最先进的NIZK构造（Parno等人IEEE S＆P '13，Ben-Sasson等人的USENIX SEC' 14，Danezis等，Asiacrypt '14）。 我们系统的应用包括为零现金（Ben-Sasson等人IEEE S＆P '13）等系统的公共参数以及（Ben-Sasson等人14）的可扩展零知识证明系统。
papers.title_zh: 简洁零知识证明中公共参数的安全采样

papers.title: Forward Secure Asynchronous Messaging from Puncturable Encryption
papers.authors: Matthew D. Green, Ian Miers
papers.abstract: In this paper we investigate new mechanisms for achieving forward secure encryption in store and forward messaging systems such as email and SMS. In a forward secure encryption scheme, a user periodically updates her secret key so that past messages remain confidential in the event that her key is compromised. A primary contribution of our work is to introduce a new form of encryption that we name puncturable encryption. Using a puncturable encryption scheme, recipients may repeatedly update their decryption keys to revoke decryption capability for selected messages, recipients or time periods. Most importantly, this update process does not require the recipients to communicate with or distribute new key material to senders. We show how to combine puncturable encryption with the forward-secure public key encryption proposal of Canetti et al. To achieve practical forward-secure messaging with low overhead. We implement our schemes and provide experimental evidence that the new constructions are practical.
papers.abstract_zh: 在本文中，我们研究了在商店和向前消息系统（例如电子邮件和SMS）中实现前进安全加密的新机制。 在远期安全的加密方案中，用户会定期更新她的秘密密钥，以使过去的消息保持机密，如果她的密钥受到损害。 我们工作的主要贡献是引入一种新形式的加密形式，我们将其命名为标点化的加密。 使用可注点的加密方案，接收者可以反复更新其解密键，以撤销选定消息，收件人或时间段的解密功能。 最重要的是，此更新过程不需要接收者与发件人进行通信或分配新的关键材料。 我们展示了如何将可点缀的加密与Canetti等人的远期安全性加密建议相结合。 为了实现低开销的实用前向安全消息传递。 我们实施我们的计划，并提供实验证据，表明新结构是实用的。
papers.title_zh: 从可穿孔加密转发安全异步消息

papers.title: Riposte: An Anonymous Messaging System Handling Millions of Users
papers.authors: Henry Corrigan-Gibbs, Dan Boneh, David Mazières
papers.abstract: This paper presents Riposte, a new system for anonymous broadcast messaging. Riposte is the first such system, to our knowledge, that simultaneously protects against traffic-analysis attacks, prevents anonymous denial-of-service by malicious clients, and scales to million-user anonymity sets. To achieve these properties, Riposte makes novel use of techniques used in systems for private information retrieval and secure multi-party computation. For latency-tolerant workloads with many more readers than writers (e.g. Twitter, Wikileaks), we demonstrate that a three-server Riposte cluster can build an anonymity set of 2,895,216 users in 32 hours.
papers.abstract_zh: 本文介绍了Riposte，这是一种用于匿名广播消息传递的新系统。 据我们所知，Riposte是同时防止交通分析攻击的第一个这样的系统，可以防止恶意客户的匿名拒绝服务，并缩放为百万名用户的匿名集。 为了实现这些属性，Riposte对用于私人信息检索和安全多方计算的系统中使用的技术进行了新颖的使用。 对于比作家（例如Twitter，WikiLeaks）的读者多的读者的工作负载，我们证明了三个服务器的Riposte群集可以在32小时内建立2,895,216个用户的匿名集。
papers.title_zh: Riposte:一个处理数百万用户的匿名消息系统

papers.title: Privacy and Access Control for Outsourced Personal Records
papers.authors: Matteo Maffei, Giulio Malavolta, Manuel Reinert, Dominique Schröder
papers.abstract: Cloud storage has rapidly become a cornerstone of many IT infrastructures, constituting a seamless solution for the backup, synchronization, and sharing of large amounts of data. Putting user data in the direct control of cloud service providers, however, raises security and privacy concerns related to the integrity of outsourced data, the accidental or intentional leakage of sensitive information, the profiling of user activities and so on. Furthermore, even if the cloud provider is trusted, users having access to outsourced files might be malicious and misbehave. These concerns are particularly serious in sensitive applications like personal health records and credit score systems. To tackle this problem, we present GORAM, a cryptographic system that protects the secrecy and integrity of outsourced data with respect to both an untrusted server and malicious clients, guarantees the anonymity and unlink ability of accesses to such data, and allows the data owner to share outsourced data with other clients, selectively granting them read and write permissions. GORAM is the first system to achieve such a wide range of security and privacy properties for outsourced storage. In the process of designing an efficient construction, we developed two new, generally applicable cryptographic schemes, namely, batched zero-knowledge proofs of shuffle and an accountability technique based on chameleon signatures, which we consider of independent interest. We implemented GORAM in Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) and ran a performance evaluation demonstrating the scalability and efficiency of our construction.
papers.abstract_zh: 云存储已迅速成为许多IT基础架构的基石，构成了无缝解决方案，用于备份，同步和共享大量数据。 但是，将用户数据直接控制在云服务提供商的直接控制中，提出了与外包数据的完整性，敏感信息的意外或故意泄漏，用户活动的分析等有关的安全性和隐私问题。 此外，即使云提供商受到信任，也可以访问外包文件的用户可能是恶意和行为不佳的。 这些问题在敏感应用中尤其严重，例如个人健康记录和信用评分系统。 为了解决这个问题，我们提出了Goram，这是一种加密系统，可保护外包数据的保密和完整性，以相对于不受信任的服务器和恶意客户 与其他客户共享外包数据，有选择地授予他们读写权限。 戈拉姆（Goram）是第一个实现如此广泛的安全性和隐私属性的系统，用于外包存储。 在设计有效的结构的过程中，我们开发了两个新的，通常适用的加密方案，即，批处理的零知识证明了洗牌的零知识证明和基于变色龙签名的问责技术，我们认为这是独立的利益。 我们在Amazon弹性计算云（EC2）中实施了Goram，并进行了绩效评估，证明了我们建筑的可扩展性和效率。
papers.title_zh: 外包个人记录的隐私和访问控制

papers.title: ObliVM: A Programming Framework for Secure Computation
papers.authors: Chang Liu, Xiao Shaun Wang, Kartik Nayak, Yan Huang, Elaine Shi
papers.abstract: We design and develop ObliVM, a programming framework for secure computation. ObliVM offers a domain specific language designed for compilation of programs into efficient oblivious representations suitable for secure computation. ObliVM offers a powerful, expressive programming language and user-friendly oblivious programming abstractions. We develop various showcase applications such as data mining, streaming algorithms, graph algorithms, genomic data analysis, and data structures, and demonstrate the scalability of ObliVM to bigger data sizes. We also show how ObliVM significantly reduces development effort while retaining competitive performance for a wide range of applications in comparison with hand-crafted solutions. We are in the process of open-sourcing ObliVM and our rich libraries to the community (www.oblivm.com), offering a reusable framework to implement and distribute new cryptographic algorithms.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们设计和开发Oblivm，这是用于安全计算的编程框架。 Oblivm提供了一种特定领域的语言，旨在将程序汇编为有效的遗忘表示，适合安全计算。 Oblivm提供了一种强大的表现力的编程语言和用户友好的遗忘编程摘要。 我们开发了各种展示应用程序，例如数据挖掘，流算法，图形算法，基因组数据分析和数据结构，并证明了oblevivm对较大数据大小的可扩展性。 我们还展示了与手工制作的解决方案相比，obLIVM如何显着减少开发工作，同时保留广泛应用的竞争性能。 我们正在开放源代码Oblivm和我们向社区的丰富库（www.oblivm.com），提供可重复使用的框架来实施和分发新的加密算法。
papers.title_zh: ObliVM:一个安全计算的编程框架

papers.title: GraphSC: Parallel Secure Computation Made Easy
papers.authors: Kartik Nayak, Xiao Shaun Wang, Stratis Ioannidis, Udi Weinsberg, Nina Taft, Elaine Shi
papers.abstract: We propose introducing modern parallel programming paradigms to secure computation, enabling their secure execution on large datasets. To address this challenge, we present Graph SC, a framework that (i) provides a programming paradigm that allows non-cryptography experts to write secure code, (ii) brings parallelism to such secure implementations, and (iii) meets the need for obliviousness, thereby not leaking any private information. Using Graph SC, developers can efficiently implement an oblivious version of graph-based algorithms (including sophisticated data mining and machine learning algorithms) that execute in parallel with minimal communication overhead. Importantly, our secure version of graph-based algorithms incurs a small logarithmic overhead in comparison with the non-secure parallel version. We build Graph SC and demonstrate, using several algorithms as examples, that secure computation can be brought into the realm of practicality for big data analysis. Our secure matrix factorization implementation can process 1 million ratings in 13 hours, which is a multiple order-of-magnitude improvement over the only other existing attempt, which requires 3 hours to process 16K ratings.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们建议介绍现代并行编程范式以确保计算，从而在大型数据集上进行安全执行。 为了应对这一挑战，我们提出了Graph SC，该框架（i）提供了一个编程范式，该范例允许非授权专家编写安全的代码，（ii）为这种安全的实现带来并行性，并且（iii）满足了对遗忘性的需求。 ，因此没有泄漏任何私人信息。 使用Graph SC，开发人员可以有效地实现基于图形的算法（包括复杂的数据挖掘和机器学习算法）的遗忘版本，该算法与最小的通信开销并行执行。 重要的是，与非安全并行版本相比，我们的安全版本基于图的算法会产生一个小的对数开销。 我们使用几种算法作为示例来构建图形SC，并证明可以将安全计算带入实用性领域，以进行大数据分析。 我们的安全矩阵分解实施可以在13小时内处理100万个评级，这是唯一需要3个小时来处理16K评级的其他尝试的多重速度顺序。
papers.title_zh: GraphSC:并行安全计算变得简单

papers.title: Malicious-Client Security in Blind Seer: A Scalable Private DBMS
papers.authors: Ben A. Fisch, Binh Vo, Fernando Krell, Abishek Kumarasubramanian, Vladimir Kolesnikov, Tal Malkin, Steven M. Bellovin
papers.abstract: The Blind Seer system (Oakland 2014) is an efficient and scalable DBMS that affords both client query privacy and server data protection. It also provides the ability to enforce authorization policies on the system, restricting client's queries while maintaining the privacy of both query and policy. Blind Seer supports a rich query set, including arbitrary boolean formulas, and is provably secure with respect to a controlled amount of search pattern leakage. No other system to date achieves this tradeoff of performance, generality, and provable privacy. A major shortcoming of Blind Seer is its reliance on semi-honest security, particularly for access control and data protection. A malicious client could easily cheat the query authorization policy and obtain any database records satisfying any query of its choice, thus violating basic security features of any standard DBMS. In sum, Blind Seer offers additional privacy to a client, but sacrifices a basic security tenet of DBMS. In the present work, we completely resolve the issue of a malicious client. We show how to achieve robust access control and data protection in Blind Seer with virtually no added cost to performance or privacy. Our approach also involves a novel technique for a semi-private function secure function evaluation (SPF-SFE) that may have independent applications. We fully implement our solution and report on its performance.
papers.abstract_zh: 盲目SEER系统（Oakland 2014）是一个有效且可扩展的DBM，可提供客户查询隐私和服务器数据保护。 它还提供了在系统上执行授权政策的能力，在保持查询和策略的隐私的同时限制了客户的查询。 Blind Seer支持一个丰富的查询集，包括任意布尔公式，并且在受控量的搜索模式泄漏方面被证明是安全的。 迄今为止，没有其他系统能够取决于绩效，一般性和可证明的隐私。 盲目SEER的主要缺点是它依赖半honest安全性，尤其是用于访问控制和数据保护。 恶意客户端可以轻松欺骗查询授权策略，并获得满足其选择的任何查询的任何数据库记录，从而违反任何标准DBM的基本安全功能。 总而言之，Blind Seer为客户提供了额外的隐私，但牺牲了DBM的基本安全宗旨。 在目前的工作中，我们完全解决了恶意客户的问题。 我们展示了如何在盲目的SEER中实现强大的访问控制和数据保护，而绩效或隐私几乎没有增加成本。 我们的方法还涉及一种新技术，用于可能具有独立应用的半私人功能安全功能评估（SPF-SFE）。 我们充分实施解决方案并报告其性能。
papers.title_zh: 盲Seer中的恶意客户端安全:一个可扩展的私有DBMS

papers.title: TinyGarble: Highly Compressed and Scalable Sequential Garbled Circuits
papers.authors: Ebrahim M. Songhori, Siam U. Hussain, Ahmad-Reza Sadeghi, Thomas Schneider, Farinaz Koushanfar
papers.abstract: We introduce Tiny Garble, a novel automated methodology based on powerful logic synthesis techniques for generating and optimizing compressed Boolean circuits used in secure computation, such as Yao's Garbled Circuit (GC) protocol. Tiny Garble achieves an unprecedented level of compactness and scalability by using a sequential circuit description for GC. We introduce new libraries and transformations, such that our sequential circuits can be optimized and securely evaluated by interfacing with available garbling frameworks. The circuit compactness makes the memory footprint of the garbling operation fit in the processor cache, resulting in fewer cache misses and thereby less CPU cycles. Our proof-of-concept implementation of benchmark functions using Tiny Garble demonstrates a high degree of compactness and scalability. We improve the results of existing automated tools for GC generation by orders of magnitude, for example, Tiny Garble can compress the memory footprint required for 1024-bit multiplication by a factor of 4,172, while decreasing the number of non-XOR gates by 67%. Moreover, with Tiny Garble we are able to implement functions that have never been reported before, such as SHA-3. Finally, our sequential description enables us to design and realize a garbled processor, using the MIPS I instruction set, for private function evaluation. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first scalable emulation of a general purpose processor.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们介绍了Tiny Carble，这是一种基于强大的逻辑合成技术的新型自动化方法，用于生成和优化安全计算中使用的压缩布尔电路，例如Yao的杂物电路（GC）协议。 微小的垃圾通过使用GC的顺序电路描述来达到空前的紧凑性和可伸缩性水平。 我们介绍了新的库和转换，以便可以通过与可用的垃圾框架接口对我们的顺序电路进行优化和安全评估。 电路紧凑性使装在处理器缓存中的装饰操作的内存足迹，导致较少的缓存失误，从而减少CPU周期。 我们使用微小垃圾对基准功能实施的概念证明表明，紧凑性和可扩展性。 我们通过数量级来改善现有的自动化工具用于GC生成的现有自动化工具的结果，例如，微小的垃圾可以将1024位乘法所需的内存足迹压缩为4,172倍，同时将非XOR门的数量减少67％。 。 此外，使用微小的垃圾，我们能够实施以前从未报道过的功能，例如SHA-3。 最后，我们的顺序描述使我们能够使用MIPS INTER设置设计并实现乱码的处理器进行私人功能评估。 据我们所知，这是对通用处理器的第一个可扩展模拟。
papers.title_zh: TinyGarble:高度压缩和可扩展的顺序乱码电路

papers.title: SurroundWeb: Mitigating Privacy Concerns in a 3D Web Browser
papers.authors: John Vilk, David Molnar, Benjamin Livshits, Eyal Ofek, Christopher J. Rossbach, Alexander Moshchuk, Helen J. Wang, Ran Gal
papers.abstract: Immersive experiences that mix digital and real-world objects are becoming reality, but they raise serious privacy concerns as they require real-time sensor input. These experiences are already present on smartphones and game consoles via Kinect, and will eventually emerge on the web platform. However, browsers do not expose the display interfaces needed to render immersive experiences. Previous security research focuses on controlling application access to sensor input alone, and do not deal with display interfaces. Recent research in human computer interactions has explored a variety of high-level rendering interfaces for immersive experiences, but these interfaces reveal sensitive data to the application. Bringing immersive experiences to the web requires a high-level interface that mitigates privacy concerns. This paper presents Surround Web, the first 3D web browser, which provides the novel functionality of rendering web content onto a room while tackling many of the inherent privacy challenges. Following the principle of least privilege, we propose three abstractions for immersive rendering: 1) the room skeleton lets applications place content in response to the physical dimensions and locations of render able surfaces in a room, 2) the detection sandbox lets applications declaratively place content near recognized objects in the room without revealing if the object is present, and 3) satellite screens let applications display content across devices registered with Surround Web. Through user surveys, we validate that these abstractions limit the amount of revealed information to an acceptable degree. In addition, we show that a wide range of immersive experiences can be implemented with acceptable performance.
papers.abstract_zh: 混合数字和现实世界对象的沉浸式体验正在成为现实，但是由于需要实时传感器输入，它们引起了严重的隐私问题。 这些经验已经存在于Kinect上的智能手机和游戏机上，并最终将在Web平台上出现。 但是，浏览器不会暴露出呈现沉浸式体验所需的显示界面。 以前的安全研究重点是控制应用程序对传感器输入的访问，并且不处理显示界面。 人类计算机相互作用的最新研究探索了各种高级渲染界面，用于沉浸式体验，但是这些接口向应用程序揭示了敏感数据。 将沉浸式体验带到网络上需要一个高级界面，以减轻隐私问题。 本文介绍了《环绕网络》，这是第一个3D Web浏览器，该浏览器提供了将网络内容渲染到房间的新功能，同时应对许多固有的隐私挑战。 遵循最低特权的原则，我们提出了三个用于沉浸式渲染的抽象：1）房间骨架让应用程序响应响应物理维度和渲染能力表面的位置，在房间中，2）检测沙箱使应用程序允许应用于声明地放置内容的内容。 房间中的靠近公认的对象，而无需揭示是否存在对象，3）卫星屏幕让应用程序在周围网络注册的设备上显示内容。 通过用户调查，我们验证了这些抽象限制了可接受的信息的数量。 此外，我们表明可以以可接受的性能来实施各种沉浸式体验。
papers.title_zh: SurroundWeb:缓解3D网络浏览器中的隐私问题

papers.title: GenoGuard: Protecting Genomic Data against Brute-Force Attacks
papers.authors: Zhicong Huang, Erman Ayday, Jacques Fellay, Jean-Pierre Hubaux, Ari Juels
papers.abstract: Secure storage of genomic data is of great and increasing importance. The scientific community's improving ability to interpret individuals' genetic materials and the growing size of genetic database populations have been aggravating the potential consequences of data breaches. The prevalent use of passwords to generate encryption keys thus poses an especially serious problem when applied to genetic data. Weak passwords can jeopardize genetic data in the short term, but given the multi-decade lifespan of genetic data, even the use of strong passwords with conventional encryption can lead to compromise. We present a tool, called Geno Guard, for providing strong protection for genomic data both today and in the long term. Geno Guard incorporates a new theoretical framework for encryption called honey encryption (HE): it can provide information-theoretic confidentiality guarantees for encrypted data. Previously proposed HE schemes, however, can be applied to messages from, unfortunately, a very restricted set of probability distributions. Therefore, Geno Guard addresses the open problem of applying HE techniques to the highly non-uniform probability distributions that characterize sequences of genetic data. In Geno Guard, a potential adversary can attempt exhaustively to guess keys or passwords and decrypt via a brute-force attack. We prove that decryption under any key will yield a plausible genome sequence, and that Geno Guard offers an information-theoretic security guarantee against message-recovery attacks. We also explore attacks that use side information. Finally, we present an efficient and parallelized software implementation of Geno Guard.
papers.abstract_zh: 基因组数据的安全存储非常重要，并且越来越重要。 科学界改善了解释个人遗传材料的能力以及遗传数据库种群不断增长的大小，这加剧了数据泄露的潜在后果。 因此，普遍使用密码来生成加密密钥，因此在应用于遗传数据时会带来一个特别严重的问题。 弱密码可能会在短期内危害遗传数据，但是鉴于遗传数据的多个十年寿命，即使使用常规加密的强密码也可能导致妥协。 我们提出了一种称为Geno Guard的工具，用于为当今和长期提供强大的基因组数据保护。 Geno Guard合并了一个新的理论加密框架，称为蜂蜜加密（HE）：它可以为加密数据提供信息理论的保密性保证。 但是，不幸的是，以前提出的他的方案可以应用于一组非常有限的概率分布的消息。 因此，Geno Guard解决了将HE技术应用于表征遗传数据序列的高度不均匀概率分布的开放问题。 在Geno Guard中，潜在的对手可以尝试详尽地猜测密钥或密码，并通过蛮力攻击解密。 我们证明，任何密钥下的解密都会产生合理的基因组序列，而Geno Guard提供了针对消息恢复攻击的信息理论安全保证。 我们还探索使用侧面信息的攻击。 最后，我们提出了Geno Guard的有效且并行化的软件实现。
papers.title_zh: GenoGuard:保护基因组数据免受暴力攻击

papers.title: Towards Making Systems Forget with Machine Unlearning
papers.authors: Yinzhi Cao, Junfeng Yang
papers.abstract: Today's systems produce a rapidly exploding amount of data, and the data further derives more data, forming a complex data propagation network that we call the data's lineage. There are many reasons that users want systems to forget certain data including its lineage. From a privacy perspective, users who become concerned with new privacy risks of a system often want the system to forget their data and lineage. From a security perspective, if an attacker pollutes an anomaly detector by injecting manually crafted data into the training data set, the detector must forget the injected data to regain security. From a usability perspective, a user can remove noise and incorrect entries so that a recommendation engine gives useful recommendations. Therefore, we envision forgetting systems, capable of forgetting certain data and their lineages, completely and quickly. This paper focuses on making learning systems forget, the process of which we call machine unlearning, or simply unlearning. We present a general, efficient unlearning approach by transforming learning algorithms used by a system into a summation form. To forget a training data sample, our approach simply updates a small number of summations -- asymptotically faster than retraining from scratch. Our approach is general, because the summation form is from the statistical query learning in which many machine learning algorithms can be implemented. Our approach also applies to all stages of machine learning, including feature selection and modeling. Our evaluation, on four diverse learning systems and real-world workloads, shows that our approach is general, effective, fast, and easy to use.
papers.abstract_zh: 当今的系统产生了迅速爆炸的数据，数据进一步衍生了更多数据，形成了我们称为数据谱系的复杂数据传播网络。 用户希望系统忘记某些数据，包括其血统，有很多原因。 从隐私角度来看，关注系统的新隐私风险的用户通常会希望该系统忘记其数据和谱系。 从安全的角度来看，如果攻击者通过将手动制作的数据注入训练数据集来污染异常检测器，则检测器必须忘记注入的数据以恢复安全性。 从可用性的角度来看，用户可以删除噪声和错误的条目，从而使推荐引擎提供有用的建议。 因此，我们设想忘记系统，能够完全快速忘记某些数据及其血统。 本文着重于使学习系统忘记，这是我们称之为机器的过程，或者简单地学习。 我们通过将系统使用的学习算法转换为总结形式，提出了一种一般，有效的学习方法。 为了忘记培训数据样本，我们的方法只是更新了少量总结 - 渐近地比从头开始更快。 我们的方法是一般的，因为求和表是来自可以实现许多机器学习算法的统计查询学习。 我们的方法还适用于机器学习的所有阶段，包括功能选择和建模。 我们对四种不同的学习系统和现实世界工作负载的评估表明，我们的方法是一般，有效，快速且易于使用的。
papers.title_zh: 让系统忘记机器的遗忘

papers.title: Cracking-Resistant Password Vaults Using Natural Language Encoders
papers.authors: Rahul Chatterjee, Joseph Bonneau, Ari Juels, Thomas Ristenpart
papers.abstract: Password vaults are increasingly popular applications that store multiple passwords encrypted under a single master password that the user memorizes. A password vault can greatly reduce the burden on a user of remembering passwords, but introduces a single point of failure. An attacker that obtains a user's encrypted vault can mount offline brute-force attacks and, if successful, compromise all of the passwords in the vault. In this paper, we investigate the construction of encrypted vaults that resist such offline cracking attacks and force attackers instead to mount online attacks. Our contributions are as follows. We present an attack and supporting analysis showing that a previous design for cracking-resistant vaults -- the only one of which we are aware -- actually degrades security relative to conventional password-based approaches. We then introduce a new type of secure encoding scheme that we call a natural language encoder (NLE). An NLE permits the construction of vaults which, when decrypted with the wrong master password, produce plausible-looking decoy passwords. We show how to build NLEs using existing tools from natural language processing, such as n-gram models and probabilistic context-free grammars, and evaluate their ability to generate plausible decoys. Finally, we present, implement, and evaluate a full, NLE-based cracking-resistant vault system called NoCrack.
papers.abstract_zh: 密码保险库是越来越受欢迎的应用程序，可存储在用户记忆的单个主密码下加密多个密码。 密码保险库可以大大减轻记住密码的用户的负担，但引入了单点故障。 获取用户加密保险库的攻击者可以安装离线蛮力攻击，如果成功的话，会损害保险库中的所有密码。 在本文中，我们调查了加密的拱顶的构建，这些保管库抵抗了这种离线破裂攻击并迫使攻击者进行在线攻击。 我们的贡献如下。 我们提出了攻击和支持分析，表明先前用于抗破解库的设计（我们知道的唯一一种）实际上会降低相对于基于密码的方法的安全性。 然后，我们引入了一种新型的安全编码方案，我们称之为自然语言编码器（NLE）。 NLE允许构造保险库，当用错误的主密码解密时，会产生合理的诱饵密码。 我们展示了如何使用自然语言处理中的现有工具（例如N-Gram模型和概率无上下文语法）来构建NLE，并评估其生成合理诱饵的能力。 最后，我们介绍，实施和评估一个名为Nocrack的完整，基于NLE的抗裂纹金库系统。
papers.title_zh: 使用自然语言编码器的防破解密码库

papers.title: SoK: A Comprehensive Analysis of Game-Based Ballot Privacy Definitions
papers.authors: David Bernhard, Véronique Cortier, David Galindo, Olivier Pereira, Bogdan Warinschi
papers.abstract: We critically survey game-based security definitions for the privacy of voting schemes. In addition to known limitations, we unveil several previously unnoticed shortcomings. Surprisingly, the conclusion of our study is that none of the existing definitions is satisfactory: they either provide only weak guarantees, or can be applied only to a limited class of schemes, or both. Based on our findings, we propose a new game-based definition of privacy which we call BPRIV. We also identify a new property which we call strong consistency, needed to express that tallying does not leak sensitive information. We validate our security notions by showing that BPRIV, strong consistency (and an additional simple property called strong correctness) for a voting scheme imply its security in a simulation-based sense. This result also yields a proof technique for proving entropy-based notions of privacy which offer the strongest security guarantees but are hard to prove directly: first prove your scheme BPRIV, strongly consistent (and correct), then study the entropy-based privacy of the result function of the election, which is a much easier task.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们严格调查了基于游戏的安全定义，以了解投票方案的隐私。 除了已知的局限性外，我们还揭示了几个以前未被注意到的缺点。 令人惊讶的是，我们研究的结论是，现有的定义都不令人满意：它们要么只提供弱保证，要么只能应用于有限类别的计划，或两者兼而有之。 根据我们的发现，我们提出了一个新的基于游戏的隐私定义，我们称之为Bpriv。 我们还确定了一个新属性，我们称之为强大的一致性，即表示Tallying不会泄漏敏感信息。 我们通过证明BPRIV，强大的一致性（以及一个称为强度正确的额外的属性）来验证我们的安全概念，以暗示其在基于模拟的意义上的安全性。 该结果还产生了证明基于熵的隐私概念的证明技术，该概念提供了最强的安全保证，但很难直接证明：首先证明您的计划BPRIV，非常一致（正确），然后研究基于熵的隐私 选举的结果功能，这是一个容易的任务。
papers.title_zh: SoK:基于游戏的投票隐私定义的综合分析

papers.title: Vetting SSL Usage in Applications with SSLINT
papers.authors: Boyuan He, Vaibhav Rastogi, Yinzhi Cao, Yan Chen, V. N. Venkatakrishnan, Runqing Yang, Zhenrui Zhang
papers.abstract: Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) and Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocols have become the security backbone of the Web and Internet today. Many systems including mobile and desktop applications are protected by SSL/TLS protocols against network attacks. However, many vulnerabilities caused by incorrect use of SSL/TLS APIs have been uncovered in recent years. Such vulnerabilities, many of which are caused due to poor API design and inexperience of application developers, often lead to confidential data leakage or man-in-the-middle attacks. In this paper, to guarantee code quality and logic correctness of SSL/TLS applications, we design and implement SSLINT, a scalable, automated, static analysis system for detecting incorrect use of SSL/TLS APIs. SSLINT is capable of performing automatic logic verification with high efficiency and good accuracy. To demonstrate it, we apply SSLINT to one of the most popular Linux distributions -- Ubuntu. We find 27 previously unknown SSL/TLS vulnerabilities in Ubuntu applications, most of which are also distributed with other Linux distributions.
papers.abstract_zh: 安全套接字层（SSL）和传输层安全性（TLS）协议已成为当今Web和Internet的安全骨干。 包括移动和桌面应用程序在内的许多系统都受到针对网络攻击的SSL/TLS协议的保护。 但是，近年来已经发现了许多由于使用SSL/TLS API不正确的漏洞。 这样的漏洞，其中许多是由于API设计和应用程序开发人员缺乏经验而造成的，通常会导致机密数据泄漏或中间攻击。 在本文中，为了保证SSL/TLS应用程序的代码质量和逻辑正确性，我们设计和实施SSLINT，这是一种可扩展的，自动化的静态分析系统，用于检测SSL/TLS API的不正确使用。 SSLINT能够以高效率和良好的准确性进行自动逻辑验证。 为了证明这一点，我们将SSLINT应用于最受欢迎的Linux发行版之一 -  Ubuntu。 我们在Ubuntu应用程序中发现27个以前未知的SSL/TLS漏洞，其中大多数也与其他Linux分布分布。
papers.title_zh: 使用SSLINT检查应用程序中的SSL使用情况

papers.title: A Messy State of the Union: Taming the Composite State Machines of TLS
papers.authors: Benjamin Beurdouche, Karthikeyan Bhargavan, Antoine Delignat-Lavaud, Cédric Fournet, Markulf Kohlweiss, Alfredo Pironti, Pierre-Yves Strub, Jean Karim Zinzindohoue
papers.abstract: Implementations of the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol must handle a variety of protocol versions and extensions, authentication modes, and key exchange methods. Confusingly, each combination may prescribe a different message sequence between the client and the server. We address the problem of designing a robust composite state machine that correctly multiplexes between these different protocol modes. We systematically test popular open-source TLS implementations for state machine bugs and discover several critical security vulnerabilities that have lain hidden in these libraries for years, and have now finally been patched due to our disclosures. Several of these vulnerabilities, including the recently publicized FREAK flaw, enable a network attacker to break into TLS connections between authenticated clients and servers. We argue that state machine bugs stem from incorrect compositions of individually correct state machines. We present the first verified implementation of a composite TLS state machine in C that can be embedded into OpenSSL and accounts for all its supported cipher suites. Our attacks expose the need for the formal verification of core components in cryptographic protocol libraries, our implementation demonstrates that such mechanized proofs are within reach, even for mainstream TLS implementations.
papers.abstract_zh: 运输层安全性（TLS）协议的实现必须处理各种协议版本和扩展名，身份验证模式和密钥交换方法。 令人困惑的是，每个组合可能会在客户端和服务器之间规定不同的消息序列。 我们解决了设计强大的复合状态机的问题，该机器可以在这些不同的协议模式之间正确地复杂化。 我们系统地测试了国家机器错误的流行开源TLS实现，并发现了多年来隐藏在这些库中的几个关键安全漏洞，并且由于我们的披露，现在最终对其进行了修补。 这些漏洞中的一些，包括最近宣传的怪胎缺陷，使网络攻击者能够闯入身份验证的客户和服务器之间的TLS连接。 我们认为状态机错误源于单独正确状态机的错误组合物。 我们介绍了C中第一个验证的复合TLS状态机器的实现，该实现可以嵌入OpenSSL中并说明其所有受支持的密码套件。 我们的攻击暴露了对加密协议库中核心组件的正式验证的需求，我们的实施表明，即使对于主流TLS实现，这种机械化的证据也可以触及。
papers.title_zh: 混乱的联邦状态:驯服TLS的复合状态机

papers.title: Post-Quantum Key Exchange for the TLS Protocol from the Ring Learning with Errors Problem
papers.authors: Joppe W. Bos, Craig Costello, Michael Naehrig, Douglas Stebila
papers.abstract: Lattice-based cryptographic primitives are believed to offer resilience against attacks by quantum computers. We demonstrate the practicality of post-quantum key exchange by constructing cipher suites for the Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol that provide key exchange based on the ring learning with errors (R-LWE) problem, we accompany these cipher suites with a rigorous proof of security. Our approach ties lattice-based key exchange together with traditional authentication using RSA or elliptic curve digital signatures: the post-quantum key exchange provides forward secrecy against future quantum attackers, while authentication can be provided using RSA keys that are issued by today's commercial certificate authorities, smoothing the path to adoption. Our cryptographically secure implementation, aimed at the 128-bit security level, reveals that the performance price when switching from non-quantum-safe key exchange is not too high. With our R-LWE cipher suites integrated into the Open SSL library and using the Apache web server on a 2-core desktop computer, we could serve 506 RLWE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 HTTPS connections per second for a 10 KiB payload. Compared to elliptic curve Diffie-Hellman, this means an 8 KiB increased handshake size and a reduction in throughput of only 21%. This demonstrates that provably secure post-quantum key-exchange can already be considered practical.
papers.abstract_zh: 据信，基于晶格的加密原语可以对量子计算机的攻击具有弹性。 我们通过为运输层安全性（TLS）协议构建密钥套件来证明量子后密钥交换的实用性，该协议提供了基于戒指学习的键交换（r-lwe）问题，我们伴随着这些密码套件，并带有严格的证明 安全。 我们的方法是基于晶格的键换交换以及使用RSA或椭圆曲线数字签名的传统身份验证：Quantum后密钥交换为未来的量子攻击者提供了前瞻性的保密性，而可以使用当今商业证书当局发布的RSA键提供身份验证 ，平滑采用道路。 我们以128位安全级别的密码确保实施方式表明，从非Quantum-Safe键交换转换时的性能价格并不高。 将我们的R-Lwe密码套件集成到Open SSL库中，并在2核台式计算机上使用Apache Web服务器，我们可以使用506 RLWE-ECDSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256 HTTPS连接，以获得10 KIB PAYLOAD。 与椭圆形曲线差异 - 赫尔曼相比，这意味着8 KIB增加了握手的大小，吞吐量仅减少了21％。 这表明证明是安全的量子后钥匙交换已经可以被认为是实用的。
papers.title_zh: 从环学习错误问题看TLS协议的后量子密钥交换

papers.title: Security of the J-PAKE Password-Authenticated Key Exchange Protocol
papers.authors: Michel Abdalla, Fabrice Benhamouda, Philip MacKenzie
papers.abstract: J-PAKE is an efficient password-authenticated key exchange protocol that is included in the Open SSL library and is currently being used in practice. We present the first proof of security for this protocol in a well-known and accepted model for authenticated key-exchange, that incorporates online and offline password guessing, concurrent sessions, forward secrecy, server compromise, and loss of session keys. This proof relies on the Decision Square Diffie-Hellman assumption, as well as a strong security assumption for the non-interactive zero-knowledge (NIZK) proofs in the protocol (specifically, simulation-sound extractability). We show that the Schnorr proof-of-knowledge protocol, which was recommended for the J-PAKE protocol, satisfies this strong security assumption in a model with algebraic adversaries and random oracles, and extend the full J-PAKE proof of security to this model. Finally, we show that by modifying the recommended labels in the Schnorr protocol used in J-PAKE, we can achieve a security proof for J-PAKE with a tighter security reduction.
papers.abstract_zh: J-Pake是一种有效的密码认可的密钥交换协议，该协议包含在Open SSL库中，目前正在实践中使用。 我们在经过验证的键交换的众所周知且接受的模型中介绍了该协议的第一个安全证明，该模型合并了在线和离线密码猜测，并发会话，前向保密，服务器折衷和会话键丢失。 此证明依赖于决策方形差异 - 赫尔曼的假设，以及协议中非交互式零知识（NIZK）证明（特别是仿真可提取性）的强有力的安全性假设。 我们表明，建议用于J-pake协议的Schnorr知识证明协议在具有代数对手和随机甲壳的模型中满足了这种强大的安全性假设，并将完整的J-pake安全性证明扩展到此模型 。 最后，我们表明，通过修改J-pake中使用的Schnorr协议中的推荐标签，我们可以通过更严格的安全性降低安全性来实现J-pake的安全性证明。
papers.title_zh: J-PAKE口令认证密钥交换协议的安全性

papers.title: S$A: A Shared Cache Attack That Works across Cores and Defies VM Sandboxing - and Its Application to AES
papers.authors: Gorka Irazoqui Apecechea, Thomas Eisenbarth, Berk Sunar
papers.abstract: The cloud computing infrastructure relies on virtualized servers that provide isolation across guest OS's through sand boxing. This isolation was demonstrated to be imperfect in past work which exploited hardware level information leakages to gain access to sensitive information across co-located virtual machines (VMs). In response virtualization companies and cloud services providers have disabled features such as deduplication to prevent such attacks. In this work, we introduce a fine-grain cross-core cache attack that exploits access time variations on the last level cache. The attack exploits huge pages to work across VM boundaries without requiring deduplication. No configuration changes on the victim OS are needed, making the attack quite viable. Furthermore, only machine co-location is required, while the target and victim OS can still reside on different cores of the machine. Our new attack is a variation of the prime and probe cache attack whose applicability at the time is limited to L1 cache. In contrast, our attack works in the spirit of the flush and reload attack targeting the shared L3 cache instead. Indeed, by adjusting the huge page size our attack can be customized to work virtually at any cache level/size. We demonstrate the viability of the attack by targeting an Open SSL1.0.1f implementation of AES. The attack recovers AES keys in the cross-VM setting on Xen 4.1 with deduplication disabled, being only slightly less efficient than the flush and reload attack. Given that huge pages are a standard feature enabled in the memory management unit of OS's and that besides co-location no additional assumptions are needed, the attack we present poses a significant risk to existing cloud servers.
papers.abstract_zh: 云计算基础架构依赖于虚拟化服务器，这些服务器可以通过砂拳击在客座操作系统上提供隔离。 在过去的工作中，这种隔离被证明是不完善的，这在过去的工作中利用了硬件级别的信息泄漏，以访问共同确定的虚拟机（VMS）的敏感信息。 为了响应虚拟化公司和云服务提供商，提供了诸如重复数据删除以防止此类攻击的功能。 在这项工作中，我们引入了一种细粒跨核缓存攻击，该攻击利用了最后一个级别缓存的访问时间变化。 该攻击利用了庞大的页面来跨VM边界工作，而无需重复数据删除。 不需要对受害者操作系统的配置更改，这使得攻击非常可行。 此外，仅需要机器共同设置，而目标和受害者OS仍然可以驻留在机器的不同芯上。 我们的新攻击是Prime和探针缓存攻击的变体，其当时的适用性仅限于L1缓存。 相反，我们的攻击本着针对共享L3缓存的冲洗和重新加载攻击的精神。 实际上，通过调整巨大的页面大小，我们的攻击可以自定义以在任何缓存级别/大小上几乎可以工作。 我们通过针对AES的开放式SSL1.0.1F实施来证明攻击的生存能力。 该攻击在XEN 4.1的交叉VM设置中恢复了AES键，但已禁用重复数据删除，仅比冲洗和重新加载攻击效率略低。 鉴于大页面是OS的内存管理单元中启用的标准功能，并且除了共存外，不需要其他假设，我们提出的攻击对现有云服务器带来了重大风险。
papers.title_zh: S$A:一种共享缓存攻击，它在内核间工作，并对抗虚拟机沙箱——及其在AES中的应用

papers.title: Last-Level Cache Side-Channel Attacks are Practical
papers.authors: Fangfei Liu, Yuval Yarom, Qian Ge, Gernot Heiser, Ruby B. Lee
papers.abstract: We present an effective implementation of the Prime+Probe side-channel attack against the last-level cache. We measure the capacity of the covert channel the attack creates and demonstrate a cross-core, cross-VM attack on multiple versions of GnuPG. Our technique achieves a high attack resolution without relying on weaknesses in the OS or virtual machine monitor or on sharing memory between attacker and victim.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们提出了针对最后一级缓存的Prime+探针侧通道攻击的有效实现。 我们测量攻击创建的秘密渠道的容量，并在多个版本的GNUPG上展示了跨核，跨VM攻击。 我们的技术实现了高攻击的分辨率，而无需依靠OS或虚拟机监视器中的弱点，也可以在攻击者和受害者之间共享记忆。
papers.title_zh: 末级缓存旁路攻击是可行的

papers.title: On Subnormal Floating Point and Abnormal Timing
papers.authors: Marc Andrysco, David Kohlbrenner, Keaton Mowery, Ranjit Jhala, Sorin Lerner, Hovav Shacham
papers.abstract: We identify a timing channel in the floating point instructions of modern x86 processors: the running time of floating point addition and multiplication instructions can vary by two orders of magnitude depending on their operands. We develop a benchmark measuring the timing variability of floating point operations and report on its results. We use floating point data timing variability to demonstrate practical attacks on the security of the Fire fox browser (versions 23 through 27) and the Fuzz differentially private database. Finally, we initiate the study of mitigations to floating point data timing channels with libfixedtimefixedpoint, a new fixed-point, constant-time math library. Modern floating point standards and implementations are sophisticated, complex, and subtle, a fact that has not been sufficiently recognized by the security community. More work is needed to assess the implications of the use of floating point instructions in security-relevant software.
papers.abstract_zh: 我们在现代X86处理器的浮点指令中确定一个计时通道：浮点添加和乘法指令的运行时间可能会因其操作数而变化两个数量级。 我们开发一个基准测量浮点操作的定时变异性并报告其结果。 我们使用浮点数据正时变异性来证明对消防狐狸浏览器的安全性（版本23至27）和模糊差异私有数据库的实际攻击。 最后，我们使用LibFixedTimeFixedPoint（一个新的定义点，恒定时间的数学库）启动对缓解措施的研究。 现代的浮点标准和实现是复杂，复杂和微妙的，这一事实尚未得到安全社区的充分认可。 需要更多的工作来评估与安全相关软件中浮点指令使用的含义。
papers.title_zh: 关于次正规浮点和异常计时

papers.title: Controlled-Channel Attacks: Deterministic Side Channels for Untrusted Operating Systems
papers.authors: Yuanzhong Xu, Weidong Cui, Marcus Peinado
papers.abstract: The presence of large numbers of security vulnerabilities in popular feature-rich commodity operating systems has inspired a long line of work on excluding these operating systems from the trusted computing base of applications, while retaining many of their benefits. Legacy applications continue to run on the untrusted operating system, while a small hyper visor or trusted hardware prevents the operating system from accessing the applications' memory. In this paper, we introduce controlled-channel attacks, a new type of side-channel attack that allows an untrusted operating system to extract large amounts of sensitive information from protected applications on systems like Overshadow, Ink Tag or Haven. We implement the attacks on Haven and Ink Tag and demonstrate their power by extracting complete text documents and outlines of JPEG images from widely deployed application libraries. Given these attacks, it is unclear if Over shadow's vision of protecting unmodified legacy applications from legacy operating systems running on off-the-shelf hardware is still tenable.
papers.abstract_zh: 在流行功能丰富的商品操作系统中存在大量安全漏洞的存在激发了长期的工作，将这些操作系统从可信赖的应用程序基础中排除，同时保留了许多好处。 传统应用程序继续在不信任的操作系统上运行，而小型遮阳板或受信任的硬件则阻止操作系统访问应用程序的内存。 在本文中，我们引入了受控通道攻击，这是一种新型的侧渠道攻击，允许不信任的操作系统从Overshadow，Ink Tag或Haven等系统上从受保护的应用程序中提取大量敏感信息。 我们通过从广泛部署的应用程序库中提取完整的文本文档和概述来实施对避风港和墨水标签的攻击，并通过提取完整的文本文档和大纲来演示其功能。 鉴于这些攻击，尚不清楚Shadow的愿景是否可以保护未经修改的旧应用程序免受现成硬件运行的旧操作系统的愿景。
papers.title_zh: 受控信道攻击:不可信操作系统的确定性侧信道

papers.title: SoK: Deep Packer Inspection: A Longitudinal Study of the Complexity of Run-Time Packers
papers.authors: Xabier Ugarte-Pedrero, Davide Balzarotti, Igor Santos, Pablo García Bringas
papers.abstract: Run-time packers are often used by malware-writers to obfuscate their code and hinder static analysis. The packer problem has been widely studied, and several solutions have been proposed in order to generically unpack protected binaries. Nevertheless, these solutions commonly rely on a number of assumptions that may not necessarily reflect the reality of the packers used in the wild. Moreover, previous solutions fail to provide useful information about the structure of the packer or its complexity. In this paper, we describe a framework for packer analysis and we propose a taxonomy to measure the runtime complexity of packers. We evaluated our dynamic analysis system on two datasets, composed of both off-the-shelf packers and custom packed binaries. Based on the results of our experiments, we present several statistics about the packers complexity and their evolution over time.
papers.abstract_zh: 恶意软件作者经常使用运行时包装器来混淆其代码并阻碍静态分析。 包装工的问题已经广泛研究，并提出了几种解决方案，以便拆开受保护的二进制文件。 然而，这些解决方案通常依赖于许多假设，这些假设可能不一定反映了野外使用的包装工的现实。 此外，以前的解决方案无法提供有关包装工或其复杂性结构的有用信息。 在本文中，我们描述了包装工分析的框架，并提出了一种分类法来衡量包装工的运行时复杂性。 我们在两个数据集上评估了我们的动态分析系统，该数据集由现成的包装工和自定义包装的二进制文件组成。 根据我们的实验结果，我们提供了有关包装工的复杂性及其演变的几个统计数据。
papers.title_zh: 深度封隔器检查:运行时间封隔器复杂性的纵向研究

papers.title: A Generic Approach to Automatic Deobfuscation of Executable Code
papers.authors: Babak Yadegari, Brian Johannesmeyer, Ben Whitely, Saumya Debray
papers.abstract: Malicious software are usually obfuscated to avoid detection and resist analysis. When new malware is encountered, such obfuscations have to be penetrated or removed ("deobfuscated") in order to understand the internal logic of the code and devise countermeasures. This paper discusses a generic approach for deobfuscation of obfuscated executable code.
